After his son Jigar’s complaint, Marathi was booked by police as the shooter. During investigation, seven others were arrested after gathering evidences against them.

Gangs of Marathi and Baraiya are involved in extortion and land grabbing. They often clashed in Chowk Bazaar and Katargam area over establishing their supremacy.

Title: CoronaVirus impact: Hyundai alerts of possible production disruptions
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Chennai: As the consequential impact of lockdown of three China factories by Korean parent due to the Corona virus outbreak, Hyundai Motor India Ltd., has alerted its dealers of possible impact on vehicle deliveries.

Hyundai Motor Corporation, Korea late on Tuesday night announced that it was suspending operations at three plants in China due to parts shortage.

The suspension of production could be nearly a week, international news wires reported. The Korean chaebol’s Indian arm Hyundai Motor India sources a very small portion of parts for its production facilities in Sriperumbudur near Chennai from Korea, which in turn sources them from China.

Sales teams officials have sent out messages to dealers asking them to place orders for vehicles earlier so that there are no shortages. “HMI factory is monitoring and checking the possibility of parts supply from China. However not sure,” the communication accessed by TOI said. “Do not feel that we are pushing for orders,” the communication read.

A Hyundai India spokesperson denied any such communications were sent and that there were no issues in relation to production. “I can assure you that there is no impact on our production schedule as of now,” the spokesperson said.

While most of Hyundai’s operations in India are localised from components standpoint, some parts do come from Korea and other global sources.

“Sadly, you cannot roll out the car without that small part which is still imported. We do not have issues for now, but if the lockdown in China continues, not just us, but the entire auto market will feel the heat,” an official at the factory said, citing anonymity. “Don’t forget, China is the global manufacturing hub for parts and components and shifting supplier is not an easy task.”

Title: Surat’s IIIT first to get own campus
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

IIIT is presently functioning from SVNIT campus

SURAT: If things move in the expected direction , Surat will host state’s first Indian Institute of Information and Technology (IIIT) in Kamrej , within a couple of years.

The state government has already allotted 28 acres of land to develop a campus at around Rs 128 crore in Kamrej. According to the collector office sources, the land is dispute-free and can be handed over immediately once the state government completes the formality.

“We have already been allotted 28 acre land and are hopeful that within next two years the institute will start taking shape on the new campus. The procedure to hand over the land is at the final stage,” said J S Bhatt, director of IIIT, Surat.

“Collector office had proposed in government for approval to hand over the land for IIIT few months ago. But we are yet to receive the order. The land is clear and without any disputes,” said Daval Patel, district collector.

Officials in collector office and IIIT informed that they visited the land and there are no encroachments or pending legal issues. “Once the land is allotted, designing and approval will take a few months’ time. The construction can start only after that. We are estimating the cost to be around Rs 128 crore,” said Bhatt.

Currently the IIIT is operating from SVNIT and it offers four-year Bachelor of Technology degree in two branches — computer science and electronics and communication. Each branch has 60 students each and the first batch is in the third year currently. At present over 300 students of IIIT are studying in Sardar Vallabhbhai National Institute of Technology (SVNIT).

Another IIIT has been allotted to Vadodara and the students are currently studying in Gandhinagar. IIIT Vadodara had been allotted six years ago, though it is yet to get a campus.

Title: Only five per cent of police stations in Bihar connected to crime and criminal tracking network
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Representative image

PATNA: The state government has once again extended the deadline for completion of central government’s Crime and Criminal Tracking Network and System (CCTNS) till October this year.

PM Narendra Modi had sought details of the CCTNS status in Bihar from chief secretary Deepak Kumar , additional chief secretary (home) Amir Subhani and other senior officers during his periodic videoconferencing held in the second last week of January, sources said.

Only 61 police stations — 36 in Patna and 25 in Nalanda — have been brought under CCTNS till date against the total number of 894 police stations and 380 higher police offices in the state. This amount to even less than 5% of total locations where CCTNS is to be implemented.

Tender for implementing the project was floated four times. It was on the fifth occasion that TCS signed an agreement with Bihar police in September 2018 with a time period of 55 weeks to complete the project. However, it failed to meet the deadline.

In 2012, too, state police had entered into agreement with another private firm but due to poor work progress, the contract was terminated in 2014.

The ambitious project was launched nationwide after the 26/11 terror attack in Mumbai. Under this project, all police stations across country would get connected with digital network and integrated with prisons, courts and forensic laboratories through Interoperable Criminal Justice System (ICJS).

The process of lodging FIR, station diary entry, filing of chargesheet and other manual works at police stations would be performed digitally.

When contacted, State Crime Records Bureau (SCRB) IG Kamal Kishore Singh said the deadline could not be met due to several reasons. “PM has been informed about the new deadline of October 2020. At 61 police stations, CCTNS is functional but manual work is also going on until things stabilize,” he said.

On October 25 last year, Singh had told TOI that implementation of CCTNS was at a very advanced stage in state and it would be done across Bihar by December 2019. “The 61 police stations where CCTNS has become functional have been connected to state data centre (SDC). Required hardware has been delivered to 513 police stations and all higher police offices. Procurement process is on for 381 police stations. All delivery and commissioning is to be completed by March 31,” Singh said.

He also said Bihar Police Building Construction Corporation has been given March 31 deadline for preparing sites at 381 police stations for hardware installation. “Internet connection of 2mbps via second version of Bihar State Wide Area Network (BSWAN) of BELTRON has been given to 661 police stations. Rest required connectivity completion deadline is also March 31,” he said.

Singh said work for digitalization of ten years’ data (legacy data) at police stations has started in eight districts. “It would soon start in the remaining districts. This step would be completed by October,” he said.

The IG said hardware for installing state’s disaster recovery centre (DRC) has been sent to National Data Centre (NDC) at Bhubaneswar and it would be completed in a month. “Police stations would be connected to SDC which would have backup data at RDC and would be further connected to NDC,” he said.

Title: Man dies as pistol goes off at niece’s wedding in Bihar's Jamui district
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Representative image

PATNA: A 50-year-old person died as his country-made pistol went off during the marriage ceremony of his niece at Markama village under Sikandara police station area in Jamui district on Tuesday night.

The deceased, identified as Mahfooz Miyan , had come from Kolkata to attend his niece’s wedding. He was a native of Roh village in Nawada district but had shifted to Kolkata around five years ago.

Sikandara police station SHO Raj Vardhan Kumar said Mahfooz had a gunshot injury in lower part of his abdomen. “The place of injury suggests that he had a country-made pistol which went off,” he said, adding that one empty cartridge was recovered from the spot. He said the incident took place around 4pm and police was informed around 6pm.

He said Mahfooz’s relative Mohammad Javed lodged an FIR on Wednesday against two named and other unknown persons alleging that they came and killed him during marriage. “But no one in the village told the police that who killed Mahfooz. Generally anger is reflected among people or relative of a murdered person and they tell everything to police in such situation. But there was nothing like that in the village,” he said, adding police suspect that Mahfooz got killed in accidental firing by himself.

The SHO said Mahfooz was initially rushed to Sadar hospital from where he was referred to PMCH. “The injured person was on the way to Patna in an ambulance when he succumbed to his injuries while crossing Barbigha in Sheikhpura,” SHO Kumar said, adding police received information about his death around 11pm on Tuesday.

The SHO said that body was handed over to family after conducting post mortem on Wednesday. “Further investigation were going on in connection with the incident,” he said.

Title: Park Circus protest completes a month
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Women protesters being felicitated at Park Circus on Wednesday

KOLKATA: The Park Circus sit-in against NRC, NPR and CAA , spearheaded by women, marked its 30th day on Wednesday. The protest, which started on January 7, is going strong despite the death of one of the protesters due to a heart attack and continuous mud-slinging from BJP leaders. Braving the cold and breaking taboos, burqa-clad women, mostly mothers and grandmothers, have been fighting with resilience and determination to save the Constitution. They have pledged to continue their protest till the new citizenship law is revoked. On Wednesday, the organizers, mostly men, felicitated the women protesters with flowers for their courage and resolve to fight for the future of the country.

Inspired by Shaheen Bagh of Delhi, more than 200 women, a lot of them with children in tow, have been participating in the demonstration every day, holding placards of Ambedkar, Gandhi, Bhagat Singh and chanting slogans of ‘Azaadi’, ‘Halla Bol’, and ‘Inquilab Zindabad’. Many feel that this women-led protest will be etched in history as one of its kind.

Nousheen Baba Khan, a PhD scholar who has been a regular protester, said, “A large number of Muslim women at Park Circus have come out in what is considered a male-dominated space and made it their own. They have defied societal pressure and reclaimed the public sphere, which has led to a change in perceptions and stereotypes built around Muslim women.”

Halima Firdausi, a political science student of Rani Birla Girls’ College and a regular at the site, felt that this movement has been a life lesson. This was the first time that she came out to lead a group of men and women with slogans. “I am shy, but this protest made me explore myself. It has empowered me as a woman and has given me confidence to face challenges in life. It is high time that Muslim women’s voices and perspectives are given due consideration since this movement has shattered patriarchal norms,” she said.

Rafiqua, a graduate, echoed Firdausi’s thoughts. According to her, women are not vulnerable and this movement has made that very clear. “We can stand up for our rights and this fight against the draconian act will be made stronger in the coming days,” she said. Rafiqua learnt how to give slogans by observing the students of Jadavpur University and Presidency University at Park Circus and now shouts slogans regularly to keep the morale high.

Asmat Jamil, a kidney transplant patient and the woman who started this protest, said, “The women sitting here are mostly homemakers and have never come out in the open to protest. But this government’s move has forced us to hit the streets. Nothing can deter us and we will continue this movement till the Act is revoked,” said Jamil. She refered to the protester who died of a heart attack at the protest site a few days ago and said, “We are unbent and unbroken and will not let Sameeda Khatoon’s sacrifice go waste.”

Park Circus has inspired many such sit-ins led by women in different pockets of the city, like Kidderpore , Metiabruz and Zakaria Street. Students, activists and common people turn up in huge numbers every day, showing solidarity to the movement. They perform dramas, sing or speak on relevant social issues and human rights to motivate the women. A reading corner has been set up in Park Circus to keep the protesters engaged in some fruitful activity throughout the day.

Title: West Bengal: Trucks choke stretches around Tallah Bridge after 10pm; detours peeve drivers
Content:
Trucks clog BT Road on Wednesday night

KOLKATA: It is not just day-time snarls that have made commuting troublesome since Tallah Bridge was shut from Friday night. Night-time traffic jams caused primarily by long queues of parked trucks have now made returning home after 10pm a harrowing experience for the public.The root of the problem lies in light vehicles and two-wheelers that have been plying along Tallah Bridge. Trucks and buses have been barred from taking the bridge since last September to reduce load till the bridge is repaired. Now that the bridge is about to be pulled down, the light vehicles have been forced to take alternative routes. Though the increasing pressure on these roads is palpable even during the day, it becomes unbearable at night when Kolkata-bound trucks start plying. For instance, goods vehicles that enter the city from Bagbazar clog the stretch from Lockgate flyover to Chiria More.Goods vehicles that enter from Cossipore are now being routed from Gopal Thakur Road to Alambazar in Baranagar and then on to Dunlop bridge. These trucks and other goods carriers are then made to take a U-turn from the area in front of the fire station near Dunlop bridge. From there, they head to Nivedita Setu , Kona Expressway and then re-enter the city along the second Hooghly bridge.Om Sahu, a truck driver, complained, “I was on my way to Koley Market from Cossipore with vegetables. Now they have asked me to take the Nivedita Setu-second Hooghly bridge route to Koley Market. This will make it very difficult to keep the perishables fresh.”This problem, a senior police officer said, will only cease once the level crossing at Chitpore is complete. “The primary problem which is causing this snarl is the detour for Kolkata-bound trucks,” an officer said. The state government has already paid the Railways Rs 14 crore for the crossing. Police had also flagged this concern to the state and railway authorities several times.Yet another route for trucks is from Dum Dum to Chiria More, from where they head to BT Road and then on to Dunlop bridge, which has been witnessing long snarls from just past midnight on Friday, when Tallah Bridge was closed to traffic. Most trucks clogging Dunlop bridge and BT Road are those that enter the city from Jessore Road. This snarl severely inconveniences commuters heading to Dakshineswar from the city.

Title: Chennai pubs turn ‘millennial cool’, get into the spirit of co-working
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Watering holes in Chennai have begun hosting working nomads by offering swanky co-working spaces and wi-fi per... Read More

CHENNAI: With the co-working boom in the city hitting a new high, pubs too are getting into the spirit of the game. On Sunday, for instance, pub and café ‘Mount Road Social’ will launch its first outlet in Chennai, and while workstations and white boards are in the masterplan, beer and cocktails too are on the menu.

We wanted to create a space where millennials can work, connect as well as order a drink and listen to good music, says CEO Riyaaz Amlani, who adds that it is the company’s 27th outlet in the country. Social, which has a 1,000sqft co-working space attached to it, functions weekdays between 9am and 6pm, but returns to being a bar at night. Social, he adds, prices the co-working space at Rs 5,000 a month, redeemable against food and drinks.

“Chennai has changed a lot in the past couple of years. People here are no longer conservative in their idea of what a workspace is supposed to look or feel like,” says Amlani, who plans to set up four outlets in the city in the next three years. “Now people are open to the idea of work and play.”

City pub Off The Record (OTR) has also thrown itself into the mix. The two-year-old pub recently began giving out its space to people who are working nomads. “We let it out as a co-working space between noon and 6pm at no extra charge. The music is turned off, wi-fi is free and we have people working out of here. It started small but now word has spread,” says Dennis Arasu of OTR. “We find that it is a good way to generate additional revenue because we wouldn’t normally get customers at this time. People seem to like to have a drink and work.”

City-based entrepreneur Vikram Chandrasekar, who for 12 years worked out of the confines of an office cubicle, says ever since he switched to using coffee shops and co-working spaces as his “office”, it has opened windows of opportunity. “Just being in a space that is not sterile or confined, where you can meet new people, changes the way you function. I’ve met people in coffee shops and founded businesses over that one-chance meeting,” says Chandrasekar, who is now into content production. “Adding a pub into the co-working space is a great idea.”

According to research by real estate and investment management firm Jones Lang LaSalle (JLL), the country has a freelance workforce of more than 15 million professionals, which means there is a demand for more than 4 million seats. Their report predicts that the total space leased by co-working operators in the top cities would be 9 million square feet by this year.

The JLL report found that co-working spaces are also intent on upping their coolness quotient as that’s what millennials seek from their work environment. Not surprising, with 72% of the start-up founders in the country being less than 35 years. Boardgames, libraries, cafes, and beanbags were added to the space. Next, spaces announced they were going to be pet-friendly — Code7 and WeWork India, in Chennai for instance. And now, after the pup, it’s the turn of the pub.

Title: Kolkata: Shashi Tharoor to discuss CAA, NRC at book fair sessions
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Visitors check out posters on current issues

KOLKATA: What’s happening around the city is sure to find representation at the book fair. And on Saturday, the current issues of CAA , NRC and the protests against them will be the subject on which writer-politician Shashi Tharoor speaks — at two sessions scheduled within an hour.

Tharoor has been consistent in his criticism of the Modi government and its choices, both in Parliament and elsewhere. So when the Publishers and Booksellers Guild got in touch with him to speak on current issues, he readily agreed.

The first session has been scheduled at 3.30pm in association with Citizen Speak, a forum of intellectuals that has been lending its voice to the ongoing protests. The discussion — ‘We are who we elect’ — will see Tharoor in conversation with members of Citizen Speak, political theorist Ashish Nandy, director Aparna Sen and chief of Future Hope Sujata Sen .

“We have associated with this session because we are a civil society platform that advocates the need for a democratic, pluralistic, inclusive society and such sessions bring forth such thoughts,” said Piya Chakraborty, spokesperson of Citizen Speak.

However, it is the session titled ‘Disorder, Darkness and the Tharoor Way’ that will see the writer speak about the fear and uncertainty over issues of citizenship and where, according to him, the country is headed.

“The city is seeing a lot of protests and emotions are running high over the issues. We are eager to hear Tharoor’s opinions. The conversation will focus on political issues,” said Samhita Chakraborty, who will be in conversation with the writer-politician.

The session has been named keeping three of Tharoor’s books in mind — ‘Disorder from World Disorder and the Indian Imperative’, ‘Darkness from An Era of Darkness’ and ‘The Hindu Way’. “We hope he gives interesting insights into Hinduism versus Hindutva as he has done in his book,” Samhita said.

Title: Parking fee row: Now, traders become Gandhi’s monkeys
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Agra: On the 23rd day of their indefinite strike, traders of Sanjay Place market dressed up as Gandhi’s three monkeys to protest Agra Municipal Corporation’s (AMC) levy of parking fee at the market.

Amid sloganeering, traders said like Gandhi’s three monkeys, public representatives are acting deaf, Mayor Naveen Jain blind and senior AMC officials dumb with regards to their complaint.

Senior Congress functionary Shabbir Abbas came to the dharna spot to extend his support to the traders.

Since January 14, traders of Sanjay Place have been sitting on an indefinite strike against AMC’s introducing parking fees at 38 places in the market premises. They claimed it violates norms, as they had already paid a one-time parking fee at the time of purchasing the property.

Secretary of Sanjay Place Market Association Heeren Agarwal said, “The AMC administration is trying to exploit traders by illegally charging parking fee, which we have already paid for. To muzzle our voices, a fake FIR has been registered. We will continue our fight against the parking mafia backed by the mayor.”

The dispute over parking fees between Sanjay Place traders and AMC is sub-judice. Traders want AMC to cancel parking contracts till the court delivers its verdict in the matter.

The association’s treasurer, Vinay Mittal, alleged despite the ongoing case at the sessions court, the AMC administration had issued parking contracts for three years to “people associated with BJP”. “AMC officials also get a share of the parking fee illegally collected from the market. We will not withdraw our protest till AMC rolls back its decision,” he said.

Title: Mau SI suspended for role in Kashi gang rape
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Varanasi: A sub-inspector of Hatti Madari police outpost in neighbouring Mau district was suspended on Tuesday after a gang rape case was recently registered against him and three others in Kashi.

According to the complaint, accused Umrao Khan was serving at Bajardiha outpost in Bhelupur area of Varanasi in 2016, when the alleged incident took place. The SI and three local residents allegedly raped a woman and made a video, which they subsequently used to blackmail her into giving them sexual favours.

The accused reportedly threatened to make the video viral if she resisted. When the woman finally mustered courage to say enough was enough, one of the accused actually uploaded the video clip on social media.

The gang rape survivor lodged a named FIR against the policeman and his accomplices, Moinuddin, Mohammed Ibrahim and Mohammed Shahid, at Bhelupur police station here on Monday.

Mau SP Anurag Arya suspended the accused cop and ordered a probe under an ASP.

Title: Chennai: ‘Keep 24x7 vigil on Loop Road’
Content:
This story is from February 7, 2020

The court directed authorities to ensure free flow of traffic on Loop Road

CHENNAI: There has been no let up in the Madras high court’s resolve to reclaim the Loop Road off the light house for motorists. On Thursday, it summoned the corporation commissioner, city police commissioner and the joint commissioner of traffic (south) to court on February 21, and ordered 24x7 vigil on the stretch.

A division bench of Justices Vineet Kothari and R Suresh Kumar asserted the Loop Road becomes increasingly non-motorable, particularly after 3pm, due to fishermen selling fish, and directed the corporation and police to maintain 24/7 vigil to ensure free flow of traffic .

“Chennai corporation commissioner, the police commissioner and their subordinates and also the joint commissioner (south traffic) will ensure that the entire Loop Road is kept free from encroachments and a 24x7 hours vigil is maintained to ensure that nobody is allowed to sit or squat on the Road or landside footpath of the road for selling fish, so as to allow a free flow of traffic of motorists, scooters and pedestrians,” said the bench.

Adding that there are also reports of people encroaching on the land side of the footpath on the Loop Road by raising constructions while the seaside footpath is yet to be created for which necessary approvals are in the process of being taken by the corporation, the bench directed the encroachments shall be identified and removed immediately.

Officials shall furnish a report along with site photographs on the next date of hearing, the bench added. As to the construction of footpath on the seaside of the road, the corporation submitted that it has given a letter to CRZ authority seeking relaxation for some time for furnishing map with scale of 1:4000 for the time being.

Recording the same, the bench directed the corporation to file a status report in respect of the new fish market to be constructed on 2 acres of land on the landside of the Loop Road and progress report of the construction with time frame within which it shall be completed.

The issue pertains to a batch of pleas, including one by Fishermen Care organisation, seeking to enhance allowance provided to fishermen families during the fishing ban period.

During the course of hearing, the court expanded the scope of the litigation and directed the corporation to regulate hawking on the Marina and the Loop Road.

Title: $55,000 seized from US-based PIO
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Hyderabad: CISF officials intercepted a passenger at RGI Airport on Wednesday, who was travelling to Dubai, carrying $55,000 and handed him over to customs officials because he couldn’t produce any supporting documents. During baggage scanning, officials noticed suspicious material in the baggage of Prabhakar Rao Tenneti and checked it. When they found the money and questioned Rao, he claimed that he was unaware of rules about carrying currency. “Rao said that he was carrying cash to purchase a house for his daughter at Seattle,” a CISF official said. TNN

Title: Kolkata: Police may draw up SOP to curb unregulated use of ambulances
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Cops inspect the spot in Tangra

KOLKATA: Unregulated use of ambulance, often at the hands of novice drivers, is a criminal waste of a key health resource, said cops and experts, referring to the case, where an ambulance driver ran over an elderly person in Tangra late on Tuesday.

Priyanka Pramanik, daughter-in-law of deceased Gopal Pramanik, also alleged the driver, Sk Abdur Rahman (26), and his brother-in-law tried to pull her into the vehicle when her father-in-law intervened and was knocked down.

Barely one and a half years ago, an ambulance, which was being driven by an underage boy, ran over a youth near the Lords Bakery crossing while the vehicle was being used for a non-medical purpose. Around six months before that, an AC mechanic was caught posing as a doctor in an ambulance, ferrying a patient to a city hospital. The charge sheet filed in the case has details of how ambulances are often misused and handled by non-experts.

But nothing seems to have changed on ground as was evident from the Tangra incident and another recent case, in which an ambulance driver was caught carrying narcotics.

Police claimed though the ambulance involved in Tangra’s incident had merely a traffic rule-violation case against it, a religious institution, which had donated the vehicle, claimed the driver barely ever updated them on the ambulance’s movements. Police plan to draw up an SOP , asking guards, where big hospitals are located, to carry out surprise checks on ambulances.

“Given the scarcity of ambulances in Kolkata, it is necessary to regularise the vehicles and put them under a framework . This is yet to be done, though a number of other measures have been announced. It is important to ensure ambulances are handled by trained personnel, and this should include drivers, who should be trained in driving ambulances. The presence of paramedics should also be made compulsory,” said the CEO of a private hospital. “But the entire ambulance business is run like an unregulated sector, with neighbourhood clubs ruling the trade. It goes without saying that they flout all rules.”

Senior cops at Lalbazar agreed. “It’s appalling that ambulances are often misused for multiple purposes even in Kolkata. Once a vehicle is registered as an ambulance, it can’t be used for anything other than ferrying patients. We probably don’t even have a system of registering ambulances. So long as ambulances are left to untrained people, the system will be misused. It is dangerous that even underage drivers are employed,” said an officer at the headquarters.

Title: Tamil Nadu: With no signal on cell, Kavalan app comes to rescue of trapped techie
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Representative image

CHENNAI: For techie Mallika, the 20 minutes she spent trapped inside a restroom at a star hotel in Nungambakkam is something she will remember for her lifetime. Unable to open the door and stuck inside with no cellphone reception, she had no idea of how to reach the hotel authorities. Only then did she realize that she had the Kavalan SoS app on her mobile phone. A click on the app’s red button and police reached the hotel within two minutes to assist her, she narrates.

“It was 11am, and it was a small room. I tried to keep my cool for two minutes. But I panicked the moment I realized something was wrong with the lock,” said Mallika, the victim.

The lock on the door was jammed and the hotel management had no clue of her ordeal until a sub-inspector from Nungambakkam approached them. After a 10-minute struggle to try to open the door, they had to break open the lock to rescue the techie.

“I tried calling out for help, but realized the hotel staff wouldn’t be able to hear it as the restroom was a isolated corner,” says Mallika. “That I have the Kavalan app struck me suddenly, and I used the SOS feature. I was surprised by the super-quick response.” This was the first time she used the app in the six months she had it on her phone. “It is nice that cops help you even in such emergency situations,” she said.

More than 1 million users in Tamil Nadu have downloaded the Kavalan app. As per data provided by police, Chennai tops with about 1.60 lakh users, followed by Coimbatore district .

Title: Times Group to organise heritage walk at Nandur Madhyameshwar bird sanctuary
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Nashik: The Times Group and the Nashik forest department have jointly organised a heritage walk at the famous Nandur Madhyameshwar bird sanctuary, about 40 kms from the city on February 8.

The organisers have appealed to the nature lovers to be a part of this event. So far, over 150 nature lovers have already confirmed their participation in this walk.

Nandur Madhyameshwar recently shot into limelight as it became the first Ramsar site (a wetland site designated to be of international importance under the Ramsar Convention) in Maharashtra. The coveted scientific tag would help in scientific conservation of the wetland.

Located in Niphad taluka of Nashik, Nandur Madhyameshwar is home to various kinds of birds, including the migratory ones. It is located on the confluence of Godavari and Kadwa rivers.

According to the organisers, prior registration is mandatory for those keen to take part in the event. The participants have to make their own travel arrangements to assemble at the bird viewing tower at the sanctuary by 8:30 am on the same day.

The local forest officials would accompany the participants during the heritage walk and throw light about the nitty-gritty of the sanctuary. The nature lovers can register themselves on 8380098107.

Title: BJP will win more than 45 seats in capital: Amit Shah
Content:
Shah was accompanied by LJP chief Chirag Paswan and Delhi BJP chief Manoj Tiwari at a roadshow in Seemapuri

NEW DELHI: Union home minister Amit Shah on Thursday exuded confidence about forming the next government in Delhi and said BJP would win more than 45 seats in the national capital.“Got a chance to interact with the people of Delhi during the elections. Delhi is tired of false promises, appeasement, and anarchy, it now wants development. Seeing the support for BJP in Delhi makes it clear that on February 11, BJP will form the government by winning more than 45 seats,” Shah tweeted on the last day of campaigning.Shah who spearheaded BJP’s campaign is widely seen have energized party’s cadre and boosted their morale, introducing competitiveness in the contest which AAP had seemed set to sweep.The former BJP chief held several public meetings, road shows and mass contact events, making up for the lacklustre state unit which remained riven dissension until the Union home minister read the riot act to local leaders.In earlier tweets, Shah shared photos and videos from his roadshows in Madipur and Seemapuri constituencies on Thursday. In one of the tweets, he said the large turnouts at BJP’s rallies were a sign of the party’s popularity in Delhi.Shah was accompanied by LJP chief Chirag Paswan and Delhi BJP president Manoj Tiwari at the roadshow in Seemapuri. BJP is holding a ‘Janasampark Abhiyan’ across the city in a bid to reach out to every household and request people to vote for it in the February 8 assembly elections.

Title: Uttar Pradesh: Crackdown on Azamgarh anti-CAA protest, 18 held
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Muslim women protest at Jauhar Ali Park in Azamgarh

VARANASI: In a crackdown on protesters staging a sit-in against the new citizenship law, police arrested 18 persons, including a cleric and a woman, on Wednesday for defying orders and starting the agitation at Jauhar Ali Bagh in Bilariyaganj, about 17km from Azamgarh district headquarters, without seeking prior permission.

The cleric arrested for his alleged role in mobilizing people is an office-bearer of Rashtriya Ulema Council.

Some women reached Jauhar Ali Bagh on Tuesday afternoon and started a sit-in against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act and proposed National Register of Citizens. By the night, scores of women joined the and raised slogans, demanding rollback of CAA and NRC. Police tried to convince them to leave, but they continued their dharna. After midnight, police realeased water in the ground to disperse the crowd and vacated the park around 4am.

Azamgarh DM Nagendra Pratap Singh, who was camping at the site, said, “Repeated efforts were made to persuade the women to end the protest. Some women got convinced and started leaving the place, but some youths standing in nearby lanes made them return to the dharna site.”

Police used force and tear gas to disperse the crowd when a group of locals allegedly pelted stones at them. Several protesters, including a woman, sustained injuries.

“Police used tear gas when a few anti-social elements began brickbatting. “The situation is under control now,” the DM said.

Police arrested 18 persons after a scuffle and heavy force was deployed in the area. The national general secretary of Ulema Council, Maulana Tahir Madani, was among those arrested.

“It came to light that members of Ulema Council had played an active role in organizing the demonstration,” said Singh.

Title: 22 Aapli Bus conductors suspended for pocketing fare
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Representative image

NAGPUR: The flying squad of Nagpur Municipal Corporation ’s transport department on Wednesday suspended 22 conductors of Aapli Bus after they were caught pocketing fare collected from passengers.

Transport committee chairman Narendra Borkar along with the flying squad visited Mor Bhavan bus stop at 12 noon on Wednesday for surprise checking. Borkar and the team was there till 4pm and instructed passengers to ensure they get tickets as soon the bus starts. The team also directed conductors to ensure no ticketless passenger is found on the bus anytime during the journey.

“Since I took over the charge as panel’s chairman, the NMC team has caught 22 Aapli Bus conductors red-handed pocketing bus fares. Besides this, the conductors caught were also found active in WhatsApp groups allegedly being used to alert ticket checkers’ movements,” he said. Borkar’s directives also led to locking of ticketing machines of 81 conductors for pocketing the fares.

Borkar’s action has also resulted in increase in the NMC’s revenue. On February 3 and 4, the NMC recorded Rs29.50 lakh and Rs30 lakh, respectively, as revenue from tickets. Earlier, it used to get not more than Rs18 lakh a day.

Title: NMC to improve facilities at truck terminal: Mayor
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Mayor Satish Kulkarni (in black suit) announced that the Nashik Municipal Corporation will provide proper faci... Read More

NASHIK: Mayor Satish Kulkarni has announced on Wednesday that the Nashik Municipal Corporation will provide proper facilities at the Dr Bhimrao Ambedkar truck terminal located at Adgaon area of the city.

Kulkarni accompanied by the NMC officials and members of the Nashik Transport Association inspected the truck terminal.

The announcement of the city mayor on the issue comes in wake of the discussion between him and the district guardian minister, Chhagan Bhujbal. The latter had also directed the civic administration to upgrade the basic facilities at the truck terminal.

“NMC will take up the work to improve the basic infrastructure at the truck terminal. I have directed the civic administration to prepare the plan and start the work as soon as possible,” said the mayor.

According to him,the condition of the roads inside the terminal premises would be re-laid and the entire premises would be cleaned to get rid of the dirt.

“The NMC would also ensure that there is proper drinking water supply at the terminal so that the drivers and helpers do not face problems due to water scarcity,” added Kulkarni.

Hundreds of trucks, carrying various materials passing through Nashik, stop at the truck terminal to allow the drivers and the helpers to rest before they resume their journey.

The Nashik Transport Association has been demanding improvement in the facilities at the terminal so that the drivers and the helpers do not face any inconvenience when they rest at the terminal.

A delegation of the association had met Bhujbal after he became the district guardian minister when the Maha Vikas Aghadi formed the state government. The delegation had sought his intervention on the issue.

Title: Kochi-based startup gets $1.4 million funding
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Representative image.

KOCHI: As the fifth edition of Seeding Kerala summit is set to begin on Friday, Entri, a Kochi-based edtech startup with focus on local languages, has received $1.4 million in seed round, the second highest funding this year for a Kerala startup.

The funding, which saw investor participation from US and China, was led by Good Capital , an India-focused, pre-seed to Series A venture capital fund.

The startup, which is accumulating 6,000 users per day and has a base of 1.4 million, plans to channel the funds to content creation and revving its sales engine. “Right now we cater to 65 different exams and we want to take it to 125 in a year. We want to scale the user base to five million in the next 12 months,” said Entri chief technology officer and co-founder Rahul Ramesh.

Entri has course content for those preparing for public service commission examinations in Kerala, Tamil Nadu, Telangana and Andhra Pradesh. It also caters to aspirants of IIT-JEE, NEET, ComedK and KEAM. The content is offered in multiple languages, including Tamil, Telugu, Kannada and Hindi besides Malayalam. Entri, founded by Ramesh and Mohammed Hisamuddin in 2017, currently has offices in Bengaluru, Delhi and Patna besides Kochi and employs more than 145 people. It also has 1,000 people from all over India working part-time on a crowdsourced content platform.

“Entri actually created a space which is a niche and people even in remote parts of Kerala and Karnataka could get access to coaching which they did not have before,” said Kerala Startup Mission CEO Saji Gopinath.

According to him, one of the best things Entri’s story tells you is that India has a very large localized market. “This is an area where we need to seriously look at to bring in investments,” Gopinath said.

Seeding Kerala summit, scheduled to be held on Friday and Saturday, has focus on high-net-worth individuals (HNIs) from the state.

“As of now, less than 10% of all the funding happening is from domestic investors. There is a need for lot more Kerala HNIs who can start looking at startups as an important constituency for investments,” he said. “They are all smart people who have large businesses but they do not look at startups as an investment vehicle,” he added.

“One good thing is that our funding size has gone up. The ecosystem is also moving. From angel funds we are moving to Series A and above funding. This is also a reflection of the maturity of the system,” Gopinath said.

Title: Groom turns simple invite into information trove
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Sanket Savalia flanked by his parents at their home in Amreli

Rajkot: The road to any big fat wedding starts with the invite, or kankotri , which forms the integral step to the days-long extravaganza. But like in all other components related to it, competition has not spared the humble invite too — it’s getting fatter and costlier by the day.

But not be done creatively, this Amreli groom literally thought out of the envelope. And kudos to Sanket Savalia’s efforts, his wedding card will be treasured by all the invitees. For, it helps people not only remember his wedding date but also about various government schemes and how these can be availed. This multi-utility invite soon turned a hit on social networking sites.

Savaliya has created two kinds of invites — a hard copy and a digital version. While the hard copy contains a summary of government schemes, the digital invite details these schemes.

The 26 year old is a native of Gadhkada village in Savarkundla taluka will exchange vows on February 9.

While Savalia is a research associate with IIM-Ahmedabad’s educational innovation bank project, his fiancée Ankita, who too graduated in management from an institute in Ahmedabad, hails from a village near Amreli district.

Talking to TOI, Savalia said, “My parents are illiterate which led them to face many challenges in life. There are many government schemes which can be helpful to the poor and uneducated people, but owing to lack of education they remain ignorant of these. I only tried to provide such details to these needy people and would consider it a blessing if even 10% people benefit from the card.”

The bride is also part of the eureka invite! She said she wanted to spread the importance of girls’ education. “I have seen that in the villages parents don’t send their daughters to study in towns after completion of primary education. I have tried to highlight the importance of girl’s education in the society in the wedding invitation,” Ankita added.

Savaliya’s father Jivanbhai, who was a diamond worker in Surat once, too tried in his way to spread information about such beneficial schemes among the villagers.

Title: Now, NMC property tax defaulters to face jail
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Representative image

NAGPUR: Maharashtra Airport Development Company (MADC), Nagpur Improvement Trust (NIT), National Academy of Direct Taxes (NADT), Government Medical College and Hospital (GMCH), Indira Gandhi Government Medical College and Hospital (IGGMCH), KSL and Industries Limited, Gold Bricks are among 464 property owners who have defaulted on property tax to the tune of Rs175.83 crore.

According to NMC’s property tax department, there are 464 owners who have dues of over Rs5 lakh and above each. Couple of years ago, MADC’s outstanding for its different properties within NMC’s jurisdiction was Rs11.26 crore and now it has crossed Rs65.78 crore.

Taking note of the pending tax dues, municipal commissioner Tukaram Mundhe has instructed property tax department to register criminal offence against the defaulters. He also directed the department to ensure that the defaulters clear the outstanding dues or they are sent to jail.

The department has compiled data of defaulters classifying them into five categories — property owners who have defaulted between Re1 and Rs4,999 (1,80,868) and their outstanding tax is Rs41.55 crore.

Similarly, 1,29,470 property owners owe between Rs5,000 and Rs24,999 to the NMC and the total dues are estimated at Rs136.29 crore. Over 11,941 property owners have defaulted on tax between Rs25,000 and Rs49,999 and the dues are Rs40.17 crore. Likewise, 3,531 property owners have dues between Rs50,000 and Rs99,999 and 1,793 property owners owe between Rs1 lakh and Rs4.99 lakh tax. Their total outstanding dues are over Rs58.96 crore.

Another major property tax defaulter is KSL and Industries, the company that developed Empress City Mall under Dhantoli zone of the NMC. Earlier, its dues were Rs13 crore and now it has reached over Rs19.94 crore.

The NADT has not paid property tax to the tune of Rs21.42 lakh.

Visvesvaraya National Institute of Technology (VNIT) too figured in the list of tax defaulters and its outstanding too has increased from over Rs27.04 crore to Rs30.12 crore. Even dues of government hospitals like IGGMCH have increased to Rs5.07 crore. National Research Centre for Citrus also has not paid property tax to the tune of Rs29.39 lakh for its property on Amravati Road.

The Nagpur Improvement Trust, which is earning thousands of rupees as fees from those using its swimming pool on North Ambazari Road, has an outstanding tax to the tune of Rs33.25 lakh.

A senior Congress leader, who is builder by profession, too has defaulted on tax of over Rs42 lakh.

Senior officials from the NMC’s zone offices admitted they are falling short in recovering taxes from big defaulters. The officials claimed that they have been issuing notices to the defaulters, but hardly anyone is responding. Of the defaulters, many have challenged the tax notice in court.

Civic activists said the NMC should act tough against all tax defaulters, but it should target the biggies first. Like any other common citizen, properties of big defaulters should also be attached and if they fail to clear the dues, the NMC should proceed with auction procedure, said the activists.

Title: AMC cracks whip on parking space encroachments
Content:
The AMC on Wednesday sealed seven units at six buildings in Chandkheda and Sabarmati

AHMEDABAD: The Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation ( AMC ) has begun a drive against encroachments in basements or on parking space. Not only are parking spaces being turned into shops illegally, basements are doubling up as storage rooms or as space for generator sets.The AMC on Wednesday sealed seven units at six buildings in Chandkheda and Sabarmati. All these units had encroached on parking space.The AMC cleared 7,730 square metres of encroachments in 58 buildings during the drive. The civic body found basements or areas meant for parking were encroached on and there were shops running illegally from there.AMC officials said that in the seven-day sealing drive, which began last Wednesday, 750 buildings were checked and 349 units were sealed in 58 buildings.Penalties of Rs 11 lakh were imposed on such buildings and the AMC removed shops and establishments running from parking spaces.A senior officer who was part of the drive said that they found illegalities in parking space even in buildings that had ‘building use’ (BU) permission. This indicated that the cooperative societies of these buildings had permitted illegal construction. He further said that co-operative societies, to earn more money, compromise on parking lots and permit commercial establishments to use these lots either for commercial use or as storage space.

Title: Chennai Metro: Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank to fund Chennai Metro, ring road project
Content:
Representative image

CHENNAI: The state government will use a Rs 10,000-crore loan from the Beijing-based Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank (AIIB) to fund portions of corridors four and five of Chennai Metro ’s phase two and a stretch of the peripheral ring road in the north of the city. The first tranche of Rs 2,298.75crore was cleared last week for extension, renovation and modernisation of the Grand Anicut Canal System in the Cauvery delta.With Union government giving in-principle approval to seek funds from AIIB, a team of the bank led by vice-president D J Pandian held discussions with chief minister Edappadi K Palaniswami and senior bureaucrats on Wednesday to speed up the process. “A screening committee of the department of economic affairs sanctioned the proposals. The next mission is to finalize and sign the formal agreements,” said a senior official.The Japan International Cooperation Agency (JICA) has funded certain components of metro rail and peripheral ring road.Of the 118.9km long phase II of Metro Rail, JICA extends funding for parts of corridors three and five running for about 52.1km from Madhavaram to Sholinganallur and Madhavaram to CMBT.The AIIB will fund 16 kilometres of corridor four between Light House and Meenakshi College, and the remaining portions of corridor five. Asian Development Bank will also be funding the project. “We will float tenders for AIIB projects by June,” said an official source. Tenders have been floated for JICA projects.The AIIB will offer a $378 million loan for phase II and III of the long-awaited peripheral ring road project for which the Centre gave sanction in September last year. While phase I is done by JICA, the AIBB will take care of 57km between Thatchur in North Chennai and Sriperumbudur, linking Kolkata, Tirupati, and Bengaluru national highways. The ring road will reduce burden on city roads, and travel time to the other national highways and Ennore and Kattupalli ports in north Chennai.Many of the tanks in Grand Anicut system are in collapsed state. “Evolved by the officials of IAMWARM (Irrigated Agriculture Modernisation and Water Bodies Restoration and Management) and Trichy region, the project will restore the system, strengthen the embankments, rectify structural damage in the 80-year-old system,” said an official. It feeds 694 tanks through 2,332 regulators and 160km of canals in the region before ending in the Bay of Bengal.

Title: Man nabbed by UP STF for smuggling contraband from MP, 2 peddlers held
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Representative image

MEERUT: The local unit of special task force (STF) arrested three members of a gang smuggling contraband in Uttar Pradesh (UP) from Mandsaur in Madhya Pradesh. A carrier Dule Singh, native of Jhalawad in Rajasthan, was arrested along with two drug peddlers to whom he was supplying over 400 grams of smack worth over Rs 40 lakh in the international market.

In a joint operation late on Tuesday, Meerut unit of STF and Kairana police of Shamli district laid a trap near Panipat road in Shamli’s Kandhla area to intercept the carrier who was supposed to meet peddlers and hand over consignment of contraband.

Apart from Dule Singh, two local peddlers - Sultan Hasan from Haridwar in Uttarakhand and Deen Mohammed from Shamli in UP - were arrested. “During interrogation, carrier Dule Singh confessed of smuggling contraband from Mandsaur in Madhya Pradesh to peddlers in UP who used to later sell as per demand in places in West UP and Uttarakhand,” STF DSP Brijesh Singh said.

According to police, apart from Deen Mohammed, Hasan had also come down to Shamli from Haridwar to procure the contraband consignment. “The arrested peddlers after procuring the contraband would make small packets of it and sell it at higher prices locally,” the STF DSP added.

Sources in the law enforcing agencies claimed costly drugs - like smack and heroin - find its maximum demand among youngsters, particularly school students from affluent background. “The cost of the seized drug is between Rs 35 lakh and Rs 40 lakh in international market,” an STF sleuth said.

Title: Elderly couple attacked with axe and killed in Saharanpur
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Representative image

MEERUT: In a brutal double murder in UP’s Saharanpur district , an elderly couple was attacked with an axe by unidentified assailants at the residence of the deceased’s couple in Rampur Maniharan area on Wednesday morning. A police team led by senior superintendent of police (SSP) Dinesh Kumar P has reached the spot and investigation has begun.

The deceased were identified as Krishna Kumar Sharma (65) and Sunita Sharma (56) who used to live alone at their Saharanpur residence in Shivpuri colony. According to locals, the couple had three daughters who were married and settled while a son is preparing for competitive examinations in Delhi. Police are yet to ascertain the identity of the attackers who are said to be known to the family.

“Around 10 in the morning, neighbours heard cries for help. Some witnesses spotted the assailants fleeing the house through the terrace. The doors were bolted from inside. The couple was lying on the floor with fatal injuries inflicted by an axe,” Dinesh Kumar, Saharanpur SSP, said. The couple was rushed to a hospital where they were declared as “brought dead”.

According to police, diaries with money lending records were also kept on the table. While police are looking at all possible angles to ascertain the motive behind the murders, it has begun pursuing the only lead in the investigation as of now - fallout with someone in the money lending business.

“We have registered a case under section 302 [murder] of the IPC. Three teams have been formed and we are trying to ascertain the identity of the assailants through CCTV footages in the area,” SSP Kumar added.

Title: Natpac suggests flyover at Thiruvallam to ease traffic
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Thiruvananthapuram: Though the widened Kazhakoottam-Mukkola national highway is a boon for motorists, Thiruvallam Junction is an exception. It is the only stretch on the national highway, where motorists drive with impunity on the wrong side of the road, posing a major safety threat.

Due to the absence of a service road across the Karamana river and the difficulty in accessing the Ambalathara-East Fort road, motorists ply in two-directions along the old Thiruvallam Bridge.

Now, based on a request from traffic south division, the National Transport Planning and Research Centre ( Natpac ) has submitted a traffic congestion mitigation study report for Thiruvallam.

While the National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) has been mulling constructing a service bridge across the river, the Natpac has suggested that it was not feasible.

The research centre ruled out the option of a service bridge as the Old Thiruvallam Junction is very close (about 80m) to the Karamana river. While ensuring the required slope, one end of the ramp will go beyond the old Thiruvalla Junction and therefore, it is not practical, it noted.

As a long-term measure, the Natpac has suggested construction of a 7.5-metre wide flyover connecting one side of the national highway to the Ambalathara Road. The new foot over bridge will have to be relocated for the construction.

For the short-term, the Natpac has suggested a segregated lane of around three metres from Old Thiruvallam Junction to the location, where Ambalathara Road meets the NH. Traffic from Kovalam and Venganoor to Ambalathara side can ply on the segregated lane.

The authorities have also been suggesting one-way regulation near Kumarichantha to mitigate the traffic issues. As per the plan, traffic from Kovalam side moving towards Ambalathara should take a right turn from Kumarichantha Junction to move towards Ambalathara Road, using the Kumarichantha road.

“One-way regulation needs to be implemented on the Kumarichantha road, which is regulated as two-way, except for heavy vehicles and public transport vehicles. Traffic from Venganoor side and that which moves towards Ambalathara, should use the service road to reach the central median opening located near Archana Royal Park Hotel and take a U-turn to join the traffic towards Kumarichantha and then access Ambalathara by taking a right turn at Kumarichantha Junction,” the note suggested.

The Natpac team has found that there was no provision on the NH at Thiruvallam Junction for the vehicles plying from Kovalam/Venganoor direction to take the road towards Ambalathara direction. Motorists have to drive till Kumarichantha, around 1km from Thiruvallam Junction, for taking a U-turn to access the Ambalathara Road.

To avoid it, motorists coming from Kovalam side cross the central median opening near the Old Thiruvallam Junction to access the Ambalathara Road by driving on the wrong side. Motorists coming from Venganoor too drive on the wrong side.

Title: Dalit outfit launches postcard campaign against citizenship law
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

The campaign also seeks DNA-based NRC instead of one that asks people to show papers to prove their citizenshi... Read More

Gorakhpur: Purvanchal Sena — a lesser-known Dalit outfit that had extended support to the January 29 Bharat Bandh called by Bahujan Mukti Morcha against the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) and National Register of Citizens (NRC) — has now launched a postcard campaign aimed at compelling the Narendra Modi government to roll back what it dubs the “black law”.

Since the launch on Monday, the outfit has got 3,000 like-minded residents to write postcards to the PM against CAA and NRC, which it feels betray the spirit of the Constitution. The campaign, which is also rife on social media, also seeks DNA-based NRC instead of one that asks people to show papers to establish citizenship.

“At a time the economy is going south following back-to-back demonetisation and GST blows, the Centre is ready to push the country towards another financial turmoil by spending crores of rupees on NRC and NPR (National Population Register) exercises. Is this fair when the GDP is at an all-time low and unemployment at its peak?” said Dheerendra Pratap, national president of Purvanchal Sena.

Pratap emphasised that the CAA was against the Constitution, as it violated the clause of equality in Article 14, besides being discriminatory in nature. “Our mothers and sisters (reference to Shaheen Bagh) are fighting bravely against this black and dangerous law. In solidarity, we ask people to write postcards to the PM, urging him to immediately withdraw the law,” he said.

The outfit leader reiterated that they wanted DNA-based NRC to identify legal residents of India and demanded a ban on EVMs during elections to avoid misuse.

Title: Director booked for obscene content
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Representative image

HYDERABAD: A criminal case was registered on Wednesday against film director Narasimha Nandi , whose movie ‘ Degree College ’ is set to release on Friday. Police, who took it up suo motu, said the case was filed for objectionable posters and obscene content.

SR Nagar inspector Murali Krishna said, “In the last few days, we have been receiving complaints from the public that the posters of the movie are objectionable and have obscene content,’’ he said. Narasimha was booked under section 294 of the IPC.

Title: TTD objects to aircraft flying over Tirumala temple
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Tirupati: The hovering of a chartered aircraft above Lord Venkateswara temple in Tirumala for the last two days has been giving anxious moments to officials of the Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams as well as temple priests.

After the aircraft, believed to be operated by the Survey of India, repeated the exercise several times on Monday and Tuesday, TTD officials contacted the air traffic control (ATC) at Chennai airport and asked them to stop its movement. Sources said the ATC officials responded positively and the aircraft was not seen in Tirumala skies on Wednesday.

Survey of India carries out such exercises periodically to gather geospatial data. However, Agama advisors and temple priests have raised objections to the flying of the aircraft over the temple. Venugopala Deekshitulu, the chief priest at Tirumala temple, said no object should be allowed to fly in the airspace above the temple as per Vaikhanasa Agama.

“We have been demanding for Tirumala to be declared a no-fly zone for several years now. But time and again, some aircraft manages to fly in the airspace right above the sanctum sanctorum of the temple, leading to sacrilege of sorts. Such incidents also hurt the sentiments of millions of devotees of Lord Venkateswara across the globe,” Deekshitulu said.

In 2012, when N Kiran Kumar Reddy was the chief minister of undivided Andhra Pradesh, the state government and the TTD had requested the Centre to declare the Tirumala temple airspace as a no-fly zone. In 2015, the AP government reiterated its appeal during P Ashok Gajapathi Raju’s tenure as Union civil aviation minister. But, the directorate general of civil aviation (DGCA) turned down the request in 2016 and made it clear that the ancient hill town cannot be declared a no-fly zone.

The DGCA had earlier turned down similar pleas from the Jagannath temple in Puri (Odisha) and Sri Padmanabha Swamy temple in Kerala. Sources said the DGCA declined to declare Tirumala a no-fly zone as it feared that other prominent places of worship in the country would also come up with similar requests.

However, flights operating out of the Tirupati airport near Renigunta normally avoid flying over the Tirumala temple, keeping in mind the public sentiment attached to the issue.

Title: Congress district president ‘held’ for inciting mob at anti-CAA stir
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Representative image

Bijnor: Congress district president Sherbaz Pathan was picked up by police from outside Bijnor court on Wednesday for his alleged role in inciting a mob during anti-CAA protests on December 20, 2019.

City’s superintendent of police (SP), Lakshmi Nivas Mishra , told TOI, “Sherbaz Pathan was not arrested. He was taken to a police station for interrogation in connection with an anti-CAA protest. His role has been found in instigating a mob on December 20. Police are probing the matter. He was later set free.”

Notably, Pathan went to Bijnor court for some work and while coming out of the premises, the police reportedly detained him. He was kept in Bijnor city police station for around five and a half hours and later allowed to go.

Pathan said, “I was outside Bijnor court premises. A police team told me that the SP wants to meet me. I went to Bijnor police station with a police team where several police officers were present. They said that I was held for inciting an anti-CAA mob on December 20. They kept me in police station from 12pm to 5:30pm and later asked me to sign a few papers, and then allowed me to leave.”

The Congress member added, “I told the police that we had staged a peaceful protest at Gandhi Park on December 18. Since then, we did not take part in any procession or protest. Police are framing me under false cases now. The police are working under the directions of BJP leaders.”

Title: Presidency University vice-chancellor shifted to hospital after gherao
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Presidency students on agitation (left); Lohia is shifted to a hospital from the campus in an ambulance after ... Read More

KOLKATA: Presidency University vice-chancellor Anuradha Lohia had to be shifted out of the campus in an ambulance around 6.45pm on Wednesday after she reportedly fell ill due to the 31-hour gherao by students since 11am on Tuesday. University registrar Debajyoti Konar said she had to be taken to a hospital after she complained of breathlessness with restricted movement.

“When she was on the verge of collapse, we decided to shift her to a hospital. We arranged for an ambulance to move her out of the campus,” said Konar.

The VC, along with 40 heads of various departments and other officials of the varsity, were forced to stay back on the campus because of the agitation by the students.

Even on Monday, Lohia was confined in the chamber for over 16hours. On Tuesday morning, the VC had left the campus and returned to her office only after five hours. The students resumed the stir after she had come back to the campus.

However, the agitating students claimed that the VC had not been gheraoed. “We are only agitating because the university authorities have not met our demands,” said a student.

Before moving out of the campus on Wednesday, the VC had called for an all-faculty meeting on Wednesday afternoon. Following the meeting teachers had interacted with the agitating students. “But the meeting failed. When we heard that the VC was unwell, we allowed her to leave the campus. We shall continue with our agitation,” said a student.

Title: Credai delegation discuss road projects with Nitin Gadkari
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Nitin Gadkari

NASHIK: Credai Nashik Metro has requested Union road transport and highways minister Nitin Gadkari to speed up the road projects undertaken by his department in the district.

A delegation of Credai Nashik Metro, led by MP Hemant Godse, met Gadkari in Delhi on Tuesday and discussed issues related to several road projects.

President of Credai Nashik Metro Umesh Wankhade said all these projects would improve Nashik’s road connectivity and help economic growth. “We have drawn his (Gadkari’s) attention towards the need to intensify the pace of construction of the by-pass of Nashik-Pune highway,” he said.

“The completion of by-pass roads at Narayangaon, Manchar and Rajgurunagar would reduce the travel time between Nashik and Pune by at least an hour,” he added.

Similarly, the delegation has requested the union minister to direct the authorities for speedy completion of the highway connecting Nashik with Gujarat via Peth area of Nashik district and the state highway from Wani to Saputara up to Gujarat border.

“Since the Mumbai-Nagpur Samruddhi Mahamarg would be passing through Nashik district at Ghoti we have appealed Gadkari to direct his ministry to set up a six-lane express-way connecting Nashik to Ghoti for Nashikites,” Wankhede said.

The delegation has also requested Gadkari’s intervention in matters related to strengthening of Nashik’s air connectivity.

“Since he hails from Maharashtra and is a senior cabinet minister in the central government we have sought his help to start flights connecting Nashik to Delhi, Bengaluru, Goa and Hindan. All these routes were sanctioned under Centre’s Regional Connectivity Scheme,” he added.

Title: Uber eyes double digit growth in Nagpur
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

NAGPUR: Cab aggregator Uber foresees Nagpur emerging into its biggest non-capital and non-metro market. The company has clocked an overall growth of 35% in 2019, and is eyeing a double-digit growth for 2020 as well, it said in a press release issued here. The company says it has completed 15 million trips in the city in the last four years.

Uber has onboarded more than 10,000 ‘driver-partners’ in the city, and is now coming up with Uber Plus — a scheme to reward the drivers. This includes incentives like free medical consultations, concession on education modules, faster airport pickups and savings on vehicle maintenance costs. The drivers are also being given easy access to life and health insurance policies, the press release said.

“We have witnessed an impressive growth trajectory in the city and are looking forward to further expanding our footprint in 2020 with our new auto and intercity offerings,” said Krishna Veer Singh, Uber’s head of west India operations. Uber Auto has also seen major growth in Nagpur within a year, he said.

Title: Gangster Baddo: Catch me if you can: UP’s most wanted gangster Baddo tells his new address to UP police, it's Netherlands
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

UP’s most wanted gangster Badan Singh Baddo

MEERUT: Over 10 months after dramatically slipping out of police’s clutches, UP’s most wanted gangster Badan Singh Baddo again sprung a surprise with a social media post pinning his location to Rotterdam, a port city in Netherlands , stirring UP police into action which has been trying to trace the maverick don in the country.

UP police’s Special Task Force (STF), tasked to nab the missing gangster, said that it could a ploy by Baddo to deflect police’s attention. However, the cyber cell of police has been alerted and asked to probe the activity.

“We were told about the social media activity on Tuesday evening. Cyber cell has been alerted and a probe has begun,” Ajay Sahni, Meerut's senior superintendent of police (SSP) said.

On Tuesday evening, two Facebook posts were made from the account of ‘ Badan Sandhu ’, believed to be of the gangster.

While one update was about his location, which was pinned to Netherlands, the other was a rant against a former UP DGP in which he spoke about “criminal nexus of police and mafias in fuelling organised crime in the state in past”.

STF’s Meerut unit, which has been leading the investigation to find Baddo, claimed that the social media activity was most likely an attempt to derail the ongoing investigation. The agency is yet to clinch a breakthrough in the last 10 months.

“We have begun investigation in the Facebook updates made from the account. This could be an attempt to mislead the ongoing probe. There is also a fair chance that he got it done from someone else. He has tried to mislead police in the past through internet calls, making it appear that he is calling from outside the country,” STF DSP Brijesh Singh said.

With more than 30 cases of murder, robbery, loot and extortion, Baddo, who was serving life sentence, is currently the most wanted criminal in UP and carried a reward of Rs 2.5 lakh on his head.

In May last year, over a month after his escape from police custody, an audio recording of Baddo in which he was purportedly in conversation with a business rival in Meerut had gone viral on social media. In the recording, Baddo was threatening the man at the other end of dire consequences if his son was not given a clean chit in the ongoing police investigation into his escape. His son, Sikandar, was made a co-conspirator in the escape.

Baddo escaped on March 28 last year after allegedly entertaining police personnel in a Meerut hotel where alcohol laced with sedatives was served. 17 people including nine policemen were booked for their alleged role in Baddo’s escape.

Known for bespoke tuxedos, Swiss watches and luxury vehicles, the gangster owns a palatial house in Meerut and is said to own businesses in Australia where his estranged wife and daughters are settled.

Title: Krithi int’l book fair to open today
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Arrangements in final stage at the Krithi venue on Wednesday

Kochi: Authors M K Sanoo and M Leelavathi will formally open the third edition of the Krithi International Book Fair and Knowledge Festival at 6pm on Thursday.

The book fair would be open from 1pm. Organized by the state cooperative department in association with the Sahitya Pravarthaka Cooperative Society (SPCS), the festival and fair is being held at Marine Drive ground.

A 46,000sq ft air-conditioned book exhibition hall is the main attraction of Krithi. Spread across 250 stalls, around 150 publishers will display books in various categories. In addition to titles in English and Malayalam, this year, there will be Hindi, Gujarati and Bengali books on sale.

As in the previous editions, students from across the state will be given book coupons worth Rs 1.5 crore under the scheme ‘one book for one child’. Krithi is aiming at a sale of books worth Rs 20 crore, including those given to the students.

Krithi has also declared a variety of contests for students, including one for drawing the crow, which is the mascot of the event. The book festival venue will also host a photography exhibition, daily film screening, magic and a unique novel photography, which will depict a novel in a series of photographs.

Krithi Knowledge Festival will be held on two stages having 10,000sq ft area each from February 8 to 16. A total of 205 litterateurs and thinkers, including Jnanpith winners Prathibha Rai and M T Vasudevan Nair, A R Venkitachalapathi, P Sainath, Shashi Tharoor, Badri Narayanan, Jairam Ramesh, Sachidanandan, N S Madhavan, M R Raghava Warrier, T Padmanabhan, M Mukundan, Vaisakhan, Pappan Padmakumar, Rajendra Kishore Pandey, Mandakranda Sen and Samarabdulla Ali, will take part in in the festival.

An art fest will be held on all 10 days, beginning from Friday at the venue near the exhibition hall. On Friday, Kasaragod Yaksha Ranga will stage a Yakshaganam performance. On Saturday, KPAC will stage its drama ‘Mudiyanaya Putran’, which was second in popularity only to ‘Ningalenne Communistakki’.

The food fest, that was a charming part of the first two editions, will have special cookery show in this edition and the whole event will be hosted on 10,000sq ft area. The dish varieties include Malabar, South Indian, North Indian, Chinese, Arabic, Kerala Thani Naadan apart from a juice counter, ice cream corner, Thattukada and Sweet Corner.

Title: 16-year-old girl gang-raped in Rajkot; two accused arrested
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Rajkot: Two persons were arrested on Tuesday night for allegedly gang raping a 16-year-old girl at an under construction housing colony in Raiyadhar locality of Rajkot on Sunday night.

Police said the accused, identified as Dinesh Boria (19) and Pritam Algotar (22), took turns to rape the survivor after she left home on Sunday evening to meet her boyfriend.

The survivor had left her house to meet her boyfriend identified as Rahul. When Rahul did not answer her calls, the survivor called up Rahul’s friend Boria.

Boria said that as he could not come, he would send his friend Algotar to pick her up. Algotar came in his rickshaw and picked up the survivor.

“After taking her to Race Course Road and Kalawad Road, Algotar took her to an under construction housing colony in Raiyadhar where he allegedly raped her. Then Algotar called up Boria, who, too, came and allegedly raped the survivor on Sunday night,” said S R Patel, sub-inspector with Rajkot mahila police station.

On Monday night, the accused released the survivor who returned back to her home. Her father who had already lodged a complaint for her abduction, lodged the complaint of gang rape after the survivor narrated her ordeal.

The police rounded up Algotar and Boria from their residences on Tuesday night.

Title: Kolkata: 3,000 runners gear up to hit the tracks at Times Half Marathon
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Fitness expert Anwar Wahab conducts a bootcamp for the marathon

By: Puja Baruah

KOLKATA: Around 3,000 people are expected to converge on Red Road on Sunday morning as the Times Half Marathon is flagged off, promoting the importance of a clean environment .

Debanshu Dasgupta, director of Straightline, which will curate the event, said the response have been great. “Over 2,500 entries have already registered and we expect another 1,000 people to join the event.” Participants can register on www.timesmarathonkolkata.com. Echoing Dasgupta, Prasanta Saha, the race director, said, “Words about the event have spread wide. It is a run for a cause, a run for the City of Joy.”

Sudhir Ahuja, a sports enthusiast, is looking forward to this event. “I am a regular marathon runner , having completed over 20 half marathons and two full marathons across India,” he said. Equally excited is model and a trained mountaineer, Madhabilata Mitra. “Running is the best way to stay fit, calm and focused,” she said, adding she tries to motivate others to participate in marathons.

Samir Agarwal, an investment banker by profession, took up running seriously around four years ago. Since then, he has taken part in a number of 10km marathons and about a dozen half marathons. He aims to run a full marathon in future.

Rana Dasgupta, CEO, Apollo Gleneagles Hospitals in Kolkata, said, “This run also stands for something else that is extremely topical in these times: the message that we should do our best to keep the city air clean. We are all aware of the poor air quality index (AQI) in Kolkata and most other urban areas of India. Air pollution around the world is poor but we have to start addressing the issue somewhere. Let us all pledge to do our own bit and not contribute to the rising pollution. We can do this by performing simple tasks, like ensuring our vehicles confirm to the latest emission norms, avoiding bio-mass burning and making sure we do not add anything that would be harmful to the environment.”

Public relations and communication consultant Swati Poddar, a fitness enthusiast, is all geared up for the Sunday event, which will have three categories of 3km, 10km and 21km runs. “I have been running for six years now. I got a chance to test my own limits,” she said.

Abhishek Lodha has an advice for people who are yet to decide on whether to participate or not. “To realize your true potential, you have to first find your limits and then muster the courage to go past them,” he said. Another enthusiastic participant is Bharat Bagla, a financial planner. Bagla started running five years ago and has participated in over 50 events in different formats both in India and abroad.

Title: Union Budget allocates over Rs 2,000 crore to Vij division
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Vijayawada: Of the Rs 6,846 crore budgetary allocation for infrastructure projects under the South Central Railway (SCR) zone for the 2020-21 financial year, the share of Vijayawada railway division stands at 32% or Rs 2,226 crore.

Addressing a press conference, general manager of SCR Gajanan Mallya said an allocation of Rs 1158 crore has been made for the Vijayawada-Gudivada/Machilipatnam-Bhimavaram/ Narsapur-Nidadavolu doubling and electrification project. The doubling project was sanctioned in 2011-12 for a distance of 221 km at an estimated cost of Rs 1,429 crore.

The Nadikudi–Srikalahasti new line project has been allocated Rs 1,198 crore, the largest share within the total allocation to the zone. The project has been undertaken on a cost-sharing basis, with the state government bearing 50 per cent of the project cost. “The section between Moturu -Bhimavaram for a distance of 56 km is complete and commissioned. Work on the Uppaluru-Moturu section is nearing completion while the remaining sections are progressing fast,” Mallya added.
