Title: Court seeks police report on petition against 2 BJP MPs
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

The Election Commission had on January 30 barred Anurag Thakur (top) and Parvesh Verma from campaigning for 72... Read More

NEW DELHI: A Delhi court on Wednesday sought an action taken report ( ATR ) from Delhi Police based on a complaint filed against BJP functionaries , Anurag Thakur and Parvesh Verma , for making inflammatory speeches recently. CPM functionaries Brinda Karat and K M Tewari had approached the court, seeking an FIR against the two BJP MPs.

Additional chief metropolitan magistrate Vishal Pahuja said, “Let ATR be called from the DCP, New Delhi district/DCP concerned.”

The applicants sought a direction to the Parliament Street police station to register an FIR against the BJP functionaries for offence under sections 153A (promoting enmity between different groups on grounds of religion, race, place of birth, residence, language, etc), 153B (imputations, assertions prejudicial to national-integration), 295A (deliberate and malicious acts, intended to outrage religious feelings of any class by insulting its religion or religious beliefs), 298 (uttering, words, etc, with deliberate intent to wound the religious feelings of any person), 504 (intentional insult with intent to provoke breach of the peace), 505 (public mischief) and 506 (criminal intimidation) of the IPC.

The applicants contended that they had filed their complaint with the police commissioner’s office on January 29, 2020 against the two BJP functionaries. The complaint stated that Thakur, junior finance minister, during a rally at Rithala led a chant “desh ke gaddaron ko, goli maaro...” in reference to persons who participated in “peaceful protests against the Citizenship Amendment Act, 2019”. He had referred to the protesters as traitors, the complaint added.

West Delhi MP Verma has been accused of giving an inflammatory speech on October 27, 2019 wherein he “threatened the protesters at Shaheen Bagh”. The complaint further stated that Verma gave an interview to ANI on January 28, 2020 where he was “provocative and communal”.

The Election Commission had on January 30 barred Thakur and Verma from campaigning for 72 hours and 96 hours, respectively, over their “communal” remarks. While EC in its order said both Thakur and Verma had violated Section 123 (3A) and Section 125 of the Representation of the People Act, apart from model code of conduct, it refrained from issuing a direction to Delhi Police to file an FIR against them.

Karat accused Anurag Thakur and Parvesh Verma of seeking to incite people “as a result of which three incidents of firing took place at two different protest sites in Delhi.” She told TOI it was “absolutely shocking” that Delhi Police had failed to act in the face of “blatantly communal and divisive public statements” by a Union minister and a BJP MP.

Title: Goa: Rs 90 lakh disbursed to ryots for crop losses due to heavy rain
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

PANAJI: Following the episode wherein agricultural fields in the state were inundated by heavy rains in 2019, the agriculture department has disbursed crop-loss compensation of Rs 90 lakh from its own budgetary allocation.

Farmers were also compensated under the chief minister’s relief fund, with an amount of Rs 70.6 lakh.

This was revealed in the ongoing LAQs at the assembly.

The data also revealed crop loss incurred by farmers owing to the prolonged rains last year, estimated at Rs 5.5 crore.

Assessment reports of bunds have been submitted by a special team that visited various fields across the state. The rains damaged 23 bunds all over Goa.

The funds required to rectify the damages are estimated to be Rs 212 lakh.

The report further reveals that the estimate has been drawn out for the bunds and the tender will be floated soon.

In one case, tenders have been invited to repair the weak bund. The department has called for the closure of breaches in the bund, Cava Khazan, at Chorao.

Two agencies - DK Bhomkar, Ponda and Ummukulu MA, Margao have been awarded the tender. The amount put to tender for DK Bhomkar is Rs 4.3 lakh and they have been given a time frame of 60 days to complete the work.

Ummukulu has been tendered an amount of Rs 4.6 lakh and the time frame given to them to complete the work is 30 days.

Title: Teaching, the new attraction among graduates in Telangana
Content:
Representative image

HYDERABAD: Breaking away from the trend of taking up corporate jobs , teaching is now flourishing as a career option for thousands of students from Telangana. From the academic year 2020-21, those aspiring to pursue their bachelors in education (B-Ed) will not only have an option to pursue an integrated course but also a new curriculum that is being framed by the National Council of Teacher Education (NCTE).There are 202 B-Ed colleges in the state with an intake of nearly 19,000. Every year, thousands of students appear for the Telangana education common entrance test (Edcet), the eligibility test for admissions into B-Ed courses. This year, the examination will be held on May 23, notification and application process for which is expected to commence from the end of February.The number of aspirants opting to sit for the Telangana education common entrance test (Edcet) saw a jump from 38,684 in 2018 to 52,380 in 2019, indicating that teaching has become a sought-after career option among students in the state. Following the Union ministry of human resource development’s (MHRD) proposal to commence the integrated course, Telangana State Council of Higher Education (TSCHE) has decided to introduce a four-year integrated B Ed course in three government colleges on pilot basis from the ensuing academic year (AY2020-21).“The four-year B-Ed course will be conducted in three streams — BA, BCom and BSc. Based on its implementation, we will be extending the same to other private institutions from the next academic year. However, the modalities are yet to be finalised,” said an official.Even the NCTE has decided to roll-out a new curriculum for bachelor and diploma courses in education from the ensuing academic year. “The current syllabus has not been updated for nearly 20 years now. The curriculum being framed by the NCTE will be on par with international standards wherein students will learn playschool methods, early childhood training which was not a part of the curriculum so far,” NCTE core council member K Ramdass told TOI after a consultative meeting on teacher education held in Puducherry on Wednesday.Higher employment opportunity in education sector is attracting thousands of students towards teaching. “These days, even coaching institutions employ candidates who have pursued B-Ed. Those pursuing professional courses are also not securing jobs. However, after pursuing B Ed, my avenues will be open from government jobs to coaching centres,” said E Sruthi, a B-Ed aspirant.

Title: Who has the best biryani? Niti chief and KT Rama Rao battle it out
Content:
All bragging rights on best biryani in the world belong rightfully to Hyderabad Amitabh Ji. Dare I say that the res… https://t.co/nZno1O98pD — KTR (@KTRTRS) 1580869894000

HYDERABAD: What started as a debate on Twitter on the best biryani in India soon turned into a full-scale war with Telangana IT minister KT Rama Rao joining the ‘battle of biryanis’ by claiming that no biryani can come anywhere close to Hyderabadi biryani .KTR said that any biryani across the world could only be a poor imitation of Hyderabadi biryani. He also said that Unesco had acknowledged Hyderabad as the “creative city of gastronomy.” “All bragging rights on best biryani in the world belong rightfully to Hyderabad Amitabh Ji (sic),” the minister tweeted. He said this in response to Niti Aayog CEO Amitabh Kant writing about his preference for a certain biryani from Kerala . KTR further said in his tweet: “Dare I say that the rest are only poor imitations. Even Unesco recognised our gourmet culture recently & conferred the title of ‘creative city of gastronomy’.”Amitabh in his tweet on Tuesday night had said: “The best biryani in world is Thalassery fish biryani from Paris restaurant. It’s made using short-grained local rice with white aikora or kingfish also known as king mackerel in Thalassery ( Kerala). It’s awesome & beats all other biryanis by miles.”Not just the Niti Aayog CEO, Twitterati was abuzz with biryani debate in the last few days with several claimants to the best biryani crown. Pradeep Sunketi, who works for a private firm in the Gulf, tweeted: “I’m here in AbuDhabi (UAE) now. When I meet local people here, they ask me where I come from? I tell them I’m from India, Hyderabad. Then they exclaim saying ‘Ohh Mashallah Hyderabad biryani masbuth (Hyderabad biryani is the best). This is enough to understand why Hyderabd biryani is the world’s best biryani (sic).”It was on October 30 last year, Unesco had come up with a list of 66 creative cities and Hyderabad was listed as the creative city (gastronomy). The only other Indian city which made it to the list was Mumbai as creative city (films). While KTR’s tweet got 4,000 likes and 650 retweets, Amitabh’s claim got 1,100 likes and 133 retweets.Mohammed Rashid of Kerala reminded Amitabh that Thalassery fondly remembers his stint as a sub-collector in the town many years ago. “Paris restaurant in Thalassery is approaching 80 years serving its unique biryani consistently over the years,” he tweeted.Just as Hyderabadis went all out to call Hyderabad as the world’s biryani capital, Lucknowites are in no mood to hand over the throne to Hyderabad or Kolkata. “Those who lived and tasted biryani in Lucknow will never like Hyderabadi or Kolkata biryani,” Prabal Muttoo of Lucknow tweeted.Shoumik Das of West Bengal also joined the race. “We, as Bengalis, cannot imagine biryani without aloo,” Das said about his preference. Claims came in from Bengaluru, Kanpur, Chennai, Ahmedabad, Delhi, Madurai and other places for their share of the spotlight.In fact, biryani started trending on Twitter and the thread saw numerous people giving out their views after Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath alleged, at a rally couple of days ago, that his Delhi counterpart Arvind Kejriwal was offering biryani to protesters at Shaheen Bagh.

Title: Large number of vacancies fuelling interest in teaching
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Hyderabad: Large number of vacancies in government schools has fuelled interest among several students to pursue their bachelors in education (B-Ed) instead of a professional course. This year too, authorities are expecting a rise in number of students applying for the Telangana education common entrance test (Edcet).

According to the Telangana State Public Service Commission (TSPSC) figures, there are nearly 9,000 vacant teaching positions in government schools and close to 30,000 vacancies in state-run schools. Due to a lack of teachers, as many as 4,587 government schools in the state are run by a single teacher who teaches all the subjects.

“Earlier, many people saw B-Ed as a last resort. But now, interest among students has rejuvenated due to employment opportunities that are available. This year too, we expect a rise in number of applications,” said Edcet convenor, Professor T Mrunalini. While the government has not recruited teachers for government schools in the last four years, aspirants are hopeful that TSPSC will release a recruitment notification shortly.

Title: Rival gang hacks anti-social element to death in Puducherry
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Representative image

PUDUCHERRY: A 24-year-old antisocial element was hacked to death by the members of the rival gang on Wednesday in Puducherry. The victim was identified as Jayabal from Shanmugapuram in the town.

The murder came to light after a woman ragpicker found the body at a secluded spot near the fire station in D Nagar and alerted police. A police team, which reached the spot, recovered the body and sent it for postmortem examination.

Inquiries revealed that enmity prevailed between Jayabal and one Panneerselvam after the former attempted to murder the latter on April 6 last year. Police said Jayabal had been issuing death threats to Panneerselvam after his failed attempt to kill him.

Jayabal was consuming liquor at a vacant plot near his house on Tuesday night. Panneerselvam and his three aides decided to eliminate Jayabal and reached the spot with sharp weapons. They brutally attacked him. Jayabal, who sustained multiple injuries, died on the spot. The gang carried the body and dumped it near the fire station, where Jayabal attacked Panneerselvam last year. Police have launched efforts to nab Panneerselvam and three others, who escaped after the crime.

Title: Bengaluru: Trained at coding school, class 5 dropout is now a web developer
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Mohammed Tanveer is armed with the right skills today

BENGALURU: From being a class 5 dropout who was employed in his uncle’s welding shop, Mohammed Tanveer, 28, is now a full-stack web developer earning a fat salary package, thanks to his grit and also a Bengaluru-based military-style coding institute, Masai School .

Coming from a financially disadvantaged family in Jayanagar, Tanveer took up several odd jobs before landing one at a digital marketing company where he taught himself the basics of search engine optimization (SEO).

“At 16, I was working at a fabrication workshop on a daily basis where I suffered eye injuries and physical abuse. That was when I met with a road accident, which left me bedridden for nearly three months. My sister taught me how to read and write. After a while, I signed up for a typing course which helped me land a job as a data-entry executive. I moved to other data-entry jobs and slowly worked my way up to becoming an SEO specialist. Over the next few years, I worked in digital marketing, but I always aspired to build a career as a software professional,” explained Tanveer.

At his workplace, Tanveer realised that despite substantial experience, several employees had lower designations as compared to those with degrees from top universities and less experience. He added, “I was initially apprehensive about beginning a career as a coder without an educational degree. That’s when I came across Masai School, a coding school for software engineering aspirants, and its six-month coding programme. I enrolled six months ago.”

“The programme has given me the right skills and in turn kick-started my career as a full-stack web developer,” Tanveer said.

Founder of Masai School and IIT Kanpur graduate Prateek Shukla said, “Having the right skills is key to building a job-ready workforce. With the growing technology, we need more people who are ready to adapt to changes pertaining to skillsets, which they can deploy as soon as they get into a job.”

“Companies today are realising the value of skills over degrees. This will open up more opportunities for aspirants like Tanveer. Through Masai School’s programmes, we aim to help more such individuals build their dream careers,” Shukla added.

Masai School began operations in the June 2019. It also has a branch in Patna and plans to train over 1,000 students in the next 10-12 months.

Title: Karnataka: 3 aspiring BSF jawans held with fake papers
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Representative image

BENGALURU: Yelahanka police have arrested three people who forged domicile documents and produced certificates to show themselves as residents of Karnataka to land a job in central armed police forces (CAPFs).

Police sources said the trio — Kapil Kumar Pathak, 23, from UP; Rooparam, 21 and Balbir Singh, 22, from Rajasthan — had cleared the written exam for recruitment of jawans by Border Security Force. On Monday, they appeared for medical examination and produced domicile certificates showing that they are residents of Karnataka.

While Kapil’s documents claimed he was a resident of Saraipalya, near Manyata Tech park, Rooparam’s papers portrayed him as a resident of Ashirwad Layout in Hoodi and Balbir’s stated that he was a resident of CV Raman Nagar.

However, officials doubted the veracity of the papers as the men weren’t conversant in Kannada. They verified the documents and found that they were forged.

Anil Singh, an official at Detailed Medical Examination Board of CAPF, filed a complaint with Yelahanka police, who arrested the accused. A probe revealed that two persons, Surendra Katoch, a resident of Banaswadi and Chandu, a resident of JP Nagar, had got the trio the fake documents .

Police sources said it was easier to get a job in CAPF in Karnataka compared to Uttar Pradesh and Rajasthan. The accused came to Bengaluru about six months ago and approached Surendra to get documents to show that they were residents of Karnataka. Each of them had paid Surendra Rs 20,000.

Police said they have sent the accused to judicial custody and are searching for Surendra and Chandu.

Title: Telangana: In Gachibowli, trees felled in dead of night but supervisor had no papers
Content:
When contacted, forest department officials said that no permission for felling had been granted for the area

TimesView The need of the hour is that more people to stand up and peacefully protest against those felling trees illegally. Once a large number of people demand that the trees next to their homes and offices are protected, governments will be forced to act against this green murder. While it is good that Telangana government has schemes like Haritha Haram, the point will be lost if prohibitive penalties are not imposed on those cutting trees indiscriminately.

HYDERABAD: Residents of Meenakshi Trident Towers in Gachibowli were in for a rude shock when a bulldozer rolled in at 1.30am on Wednesday. When they stepped out to see what the commotion was all about, they realised trees adjacent to their compound wall were being felled indiscriminately. “They chopped about 15 to 20 trees at night. Could these trees not have been translocated?” asked Sumant Pinnamaneni, general secretary of Meenakshi Trident towers.When questioned, the supervisor in-charge of the felling said that it was being done for a pipeline to be laid. The supervisor, however, could not produce the requisite documents showing permission for the chopping of trees. “The road connects several communities. It sees heavy traffic every day. The people chopping the trees were working in a private capacity. They must have felt their work would go unnoticed in the wee hours of the morning,” said Satish Vakati, president of the residents’ associationSpeaking about the destruction of green cover in the are, Vakati said: “These were canopied trees which are rich in biodiversity. The workers said they would chop more trees in the coming days, even those right in front of our community.” Stating that residents must be given forewarning about such activities, one of the residents, Sandeep Ramkrishnan said: “The city already has minimal green spread. If trees are chopped as and when one pleases, there is no saving us.”Tweeting about the incident, Uday Krishna of the Vata Foundation, which helps in translocation of trees, said: “Dark Secret: while bosses talk about increasing green cover.. the lieutenants destroy existing trees under the cover of darkness. Trees being cut illegally last night... Will translocation never be considered?” He confirmed that the trees cut were Gulmohars.When contacted, forest officials said that no permission had been given for felling. “Our officers will inspect the site today (Wednesday) and confirm the legality,” said forest section officer for the area, Srikanth.

Title: Rubab royalty duo from Baramulla vow to hold audience spellbound
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Rubab players at Sarhad School in Katraj

PUNE: As the Kashmir Valley was under lockdown for much of the second half of 2019, Abdul Hamid Bhat’s travel plans ended up in a flaming mess. His planned performance tour across the country and world, showcasing the signature Kashmiri rubab , crashed and burned.

“The situation was not great. I had many performances lined up in India, even in the United States. But because of the shutdown, we could get nothing done. All phone lines were down and we could not travel anywhere, including to the United States or even to Pune. This concert is happening after the third attempt at organizing it,” Bhat said, speaking about his upcoming concert on Friday in Pune.

Bhat will also receive an award for communal harmony from the cultural organization Sarhad. The award, quite fittingly, is named after Bhai Mardana, the disciple of the founder of Sikhism Guru Nanak. Bhai Mardana, who was born into a Muslim family, played the rubab and sang the word of Nanak, preaching communal harmony.

Bhat, 45, his 25 year-old cousin and protégé Yawar, and others in his travelling party to this city, are almost of royalty when it comes to the Kashmiri variant of the rubab, the lutelike instrument that originated in Afghanistan. In fact, it has become almost a national symbol of that country. In the Kashmir valley, the instrument is also a cultural icon and Bhat’s ancestors have played no small part in keeping the rubab alive and relevant.

Bhat’s grandfather Sanaullah, an artist with the All India Radio, manufactured Kashmiri rubabs at their home in Kreeri, a hamlet in the Baramulla district of Jammu and Kashmir. With him, a gharana developed, and their distinctive style of rubabs they manufactured, as well as the performances, won them many audiences and fans around the world. Sanaullah had even worked with legends of Indian popular and classical music, including Asha Bhosle and Begum Akhtar.

The pietra dura-like work on the body is an alluring a sight as the melody generated through the 17 strings, amplified with a goatskin sound box. But it has not attract much government support, much to the dismay of Bhat and Yawar.

“Rubabs are a dying art. We are trying our best to keep it alive. Though it can be of enormous tourism potential, no government has done enough to sustain the art or support it. In the 1950s, our guru Sanaullah Bhat performed for Jawaharlal Nehru, who was very impressed and promised to support him. Sanaullah declined any support, because he just wanted to play the rubab. We want to set up an academy in Baramulla but nothing has moved with any government until now,” said Yawar.

Title: Techie who killed mom arrested in Andamans along with friend
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Bengaluru: A 33-year-old techie who was on the run after allegedly bludgeoning her mother to death and attempting to murder her brother at their house near KR Puram early on Sunday was arrested along with her friend from a hotel in Port Blair, Andaman and Nicobar Islands, on Wednesday morning.

C Amruta and Sridhar Rao were produced before a court in Port Blair to get a transit warrant, deputy commissioner of police (Whitefield) MN Anuchet said. Police initially thought she had committed the crime as she was unable to repay a loan of Rs 15 lakh and feared being humiliated by the lenders.

“But now we strongly suspect that Amruta and Rao were in a relationship, which was opposed by her mother and brother. We don’t see any other reason for her to attack her family members. We can get more details only after questioning the duo,” another police officer said, adding, “The most important question is: Did Rao know Amruta was going to kill her mother? Or he got to know about it only later? He’d booked their air tickets to Port Blair on January 31 itself.”

Rao and Amruta worked together in a software company in Whitefield till 2017. “Then they joined different firms and were in constant touch,” police said.

Preliminary probe revealed the duo flew to Port Blair by catching a flight from Kempegowda International Airport (KIA) at 6.30am on Sunday. CCTV footage had shown Rao — wearing a full-face helmet and carrying a backpack — waiting near Amruta’s house on a gearless scooter on Sunday morning. After she arrived, they chatted for a while before riding away. They arrived at KIA on the same bike, police said.

“We checked the passengers’ list at KIA for that day and found Amruta’s name. With the help of Port Blair police, we traced the duo to a hotel,” an investigating officer said.

On Sunday morning, Amruta hit her 54-year-old mother C Nirmala on the head with a digging bar. She later stabbed her younger brother C Harish in the neck. Harish collapsed and thinking that he was dead, she left the house.

In his statement to police, Harish stated, “Around 4.30am, Amruta entered my room and stabbed me. I asked her what was wrong. She said she had a debt of Rs 15 lakh and didn’t want the debtors to harass me and our mother.”

Title: Will female scent draw killer leopard of Rangareddy?
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

The leopard which has been lurking in Yacharam, Kadthal and Kandukur mandals of Rangareddy district made its l... Read More

HYDERABAD: From using transparent partitions inside trap cages to covering the traps with camouflage-patterned cloth, the forest department has been trying several innovative methods to capture the elusive male leopard that has killed 56 animals and has been giving sleepless nights to villagers in Rangareddy district over the past one year. Now in another unusual method, forest officials are trying to draw the big cat close to the trap cages by sprinkling urine sample of a female leopard in the area where it made its last kill.

“Leopards are very intelligent animals and this one refuses to fall prey to traps and even ignored a wide variety of live baits left inside cages. We are now trying to draw the leopard close to cages by sprinkling urine samples of a female leopard that we procured from the Nehru Zoological Park ,” forest divisional officer of Amangal, M Janakiram told TOI.

“Female leopards leave a scent in their urine which will indicate to the male that she is ready to mate. This method was suggested to us by a few experts. We are trying everything and any idea that might work,” Janakiram said. However, all traps have failed to lure this leopard since it made its first kill in January last year.

The leopard which has been lurking in Yacharam, Kadthal and Kandukur mandals of Rangareddy district made its last kill on Saturday in Mangalpally village of Amangal mandal by jumping over a 6ft fence and killing six goats in one go.

“Forest officials are placing camera traps and trap cages in the area after every kill but the leopard is not returning to the same village again. They have tried leaving the left-over prey in the same spot every time after the leopard killed the cattle in the villages hoping that it will come back to finish its kill but they had to eventually accept defeat after waiting for two or three days. Even the tranquillising teams had to return after spending several nights in the villages after the kill a few months ago,” said Mirza Kareem Baig, a member of the Forest and Wildlife Protection Society (FAWPS).

“Leopards think more than once before entering an area that looks suspicious. We are hoping that the new methods being implemented by forest officials will help capture the leopard soon so that they can safely relocate it inside the forest,” said Baig.

Title: Hyderabad: Four arrested for murder of history-sheeter
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Representative image

HYDERABAD: Four persons were arrested on Tuesday night for their alleged role in the recent murder of history-sheeter Syed Imran at Moinpura in Kamatipura. Police arrested Tajuddin, Shareefuddin, from Kamatipura , both real estate brokers; Md Ali, a cook from Kamatipura, and Md Azeem Khan, a scrap vendor from Bahadurpura.

On February 2, Syed Imran, 33, a history-sheeter of Kamatipura was stabbed at Moinpura by assailants. Family members rushed him to Osmania Hospital , where he succumbed to injuries. During investigation, police found out that the four bore a grudge against Imran, who had a criminal past, and stabbed him to death in the early hours of February 2. Police arrested the accused on Tuesday night at Bahadurpura and recovered three knives from their possession. The accused were remanded in judicial custody on Wednesday.

Title: Bengaluru: Woman chooses TikTok over spouse after he objects to her raunchy videos
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Representative image

BENGALURU: A woman with a few lakh followers on video-sharing app TikTok chose to part ways with her husband of 12 years after he vehemently objected to her posting videos that he termed were ‘damaging to family values.’

Faris and Najma (both names changed) entered into wedlock in the summer of 2008 and lived in a joint family in central Bengaluru. A sales representative, Faris landed a job in Saudi Arabia and shifted to the Gulf nation leaving his wife with her parents. The couple was blessed with a baby boy in 2014.

“Three years ago, the woman’s neighbour introduced her to TikTok and she instantly got hooked to it. With a pseudo handle, she started making videos and enjoying the online attention she was receiving in terms of followers and likes,” said Ekbal Ahmed, a senior counsellor at Parihar family counselling centre at the police commissionerate. He handled the couple’s case after they approached the centre to settle their differences.

Earlier in 2019, Faris, amid work in Riyadh, received a shocker when a friend from back home sent him a TikTok video of a woman allegedly performing an obscene dance. “He couldn’t believe it when his friend told him it was his wife who was performing in the video, which had received lakhs of likes and elicited thousands of lewd comments on TikTok. He confronted his wife through phone and video calls only to hear her blaming the friend, who she said was making mischief by morphing her images on to lewd dance moves,” Ahmed added.

Unconvinced by his wife’s protestations, Faris quit his well-paying job and flew down to Bengaluru in early October. He confronted Najma with numerous videos of hers on TikTok but she burst into tears accusing him of doubting her. Finally, one video made in their house exposed Najma’s lies.

“She finally admitted to having made and posted numerous videos, including obscene ones, due to the response and popularity she received on TikTok. The husband then approached police, who referred the matter to us. We tried to reconcile the couple through counselling,” said the senior counsellor.

But the woman was determined to continue being on TikTok and didn’t want to forgo lakhs of fans who had lauded her performances over the years.

“We have come across numerous cases of social media related marital discord in recent months and have to handle each one with utmost care. No one can be blamed for their individual actions and we can only try to bring about an amicable solution through counselling. The aim is to save the relationship or marriage by mending whatever differences there may be,” said Rani Shetty, head of Parihar.

The couple is headed for divorce and is set to battle it out over their son’s custody.

Title: Coronavirus in Hyderabad: Another 12 moved to isolation wards
Content:
Picture used for representational purpose only

HYDERABAD: City hospitals reported 12 fresh suspected cases of the Novel Coronavirus (2019-nCoV) on Wednesday, taking the total count of suspected cases to 63. The patients have been kept in the isolation wards at the state-run Gandhi and Fever hospitals. Of the 12, three are said to be air-hostesses with a prominent airline.“Of the 12, eight people have been admitted to Gandhi Hospital while the remaining four are at Fever Hospital. Their samples have been collected and are undergoing tests. The samples of 25 others have tested negative for the virus,” said Vijay Kumar, state nodal officer for Corona. While most of these people walked into the hospitals with complaints of fever, on Wednesday, some of them were picked up by the Integrated Disease Surveillance Programme teams.Meanwhile, in wake of the novel Coronavirus vigil resulting in many suspected patients being put in isolation facilities, district officials have now been asked to prepare teams to manage post traumatic events and stress during quarantine. So far, around 60 people who returned from Wuhan and other parts of China were kept in isolation wards (briefly) while many were asked to maintain self-quarantine at home for 28 days.“Isolation even for 24 hours is likely to have a psychological impact. A person in quarantine is not even allowed to interact with family members and exposure to doctors or nurses is minimal. This causes immense stress to many people who have never been on their own, without any contact with the outside world for even a few hours. Moreover, the number of suspected cases are on the rise and going by number of people who have returned from China as well as other affected countries, people observing self-quarantine will be in thousands,” said a senior health department official, speaking about the reason for the move.In fact, similar orders have also been given by the Kerala government in its action plan to tackle the outbreak of Novel Coronavirus. The Telangana health department is closely following the action plan of Kerala in preparation for an outbreak. Health authorities are also keeping close tabs on the daily situation of the outbreak in China and other affected countries, trying to trace patterns in the outbreak, hoping to pick queues from it. “These updates are being sent to district level authorities on a daily basis,” added the health official.

Title: Sugarcane farmers suspend strike
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Ponda: Following chief minister Pramod Sawant requesting a meeting them, agitating sugarcane cultivators from Dharbandora and surrounding areas have temporarily suspended their protest scheduled to be held on Thursday over non-payment of promised cane price. Vice chairman of the Goa Sugarcane Cultivators’ Association Harshad Prabhudesai on Wednesday saidthat they received a letter from the Registrar of Cooperative Societies saying the CM wishes to meet a group of the association’s functionaries on Friday to discuss their demands and issues. tnn

Title: Only-women auto stand to open on Thursday in Pune
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Representative image

PIMPRI CHINCHWAD: The first only-women autorickshaw stand in the district will open on Thursday at the Bhakti Shakti Chowk in Nigdi. It will be called the Krantijyoti Savitribai Phule autorickshaw stand.

Baba Kamble, president of Maharashtra Rickshaw Panchayat, said, “A year ago, our organization helped over 100 women from across the city to get licences, permits to drive autorickshaws. It was difficult for them to pick up passengers from the many men-dominated stands so we started this for them.”

Asha Kamble, president of Gharkam Mahila Sabha, said they helped most of the women autorickshaw drivers purchase the vehicles on of loans.

Title: Kiran Bedi refutes charges of running a parallel government
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Kiran Bedi

PUDUCHERRY: Lieutenant governor Kiran Bedi has refuted charges of running a ‘parallel government’ levelled by the council of ministers headed by chief minister V Narayanasamy and said as a public servant she was bound to act as per laws, rules and regulations.

Speaking to reporters after releasing books published by Raj Nivas on Wednesday, Bedi reiterated that as a lieutenant governor she does not enjoy immunity while a full-fledged governor does. “I don’t have any immunity and any wrongdoing can invite punishment. My responsibilities on financial matters are higher,” she said.

When queried about the Union home ministry’s direction to delegate more financial powers to ministers and secretaries to the government, Bedi said she did so but with riders on some matters like sanctioning grant-in-aid.

Bedi said differences between Raj Nivas and the council of ministers are bound to occur as everyone reads the laws, rules and regulations as it suits them.

She expressed optimism that the Madras high court will pass a final verdict on the case challenging the powers of the lieutenant governor. “Let the court decide on the issue,” she said.

She maintained that she was bound to refer the issues on which the lieutenant governor and the council of ministers have differences to the Union home ministry. The ministry on some issues took the stand of the council of ministers and on other occasions of the lieutenant governor.

Bedi underscored that she was here not to compete with anybody but to serve the Union territory and its people.

“Our objective is to make the Union territory better. I am not here to compete but to serve. There is no ego involved in it,” she said.

She released a book titled ‘Tracking the News’ published by Raj Nivas. The book is a thematic compilation of selected news reports on a wide range of issues, including the power tussle between Raj Nivas and the council of ministers, published by English and Tamil newspapers in 2019.

She also released a book that outlined the public grievance system in place at Raj Nivas.

Title: Melavalavu massacre case: Hearing in plea against convicts’ release on February 18
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Representative image

The Madras high court will hear the plea challenging the release of 13 convicts who were involved in the Melavalavu massacre case , on February 18.

A public interest litigation (PIL) was filed by advocate P Rathinam, appearing as party-in-person challenging the GOs passed for the premature release of the 13 convicts.

The case involves the massacre of six dalits at Melavalavu on June 30, 1997, by members of another caste following the election of a dalit as the village council president. The state government released all the 13 convicts citing good conduct in November 2019.

During the course of hearing, a division bench directed the 13 convicts not to enter Melavalavu village in Madurai district and that they should stay at Vellore district till the disposal of this petition. The court also directed that they should report before the Vellore district probation officer on the second and fourth Sundays and before the Vellore superintendent of police on the first and third Sundays.

During the previous hearing, when the case was placed before a division bench of justice S S Sundar and justice A D Jagadish Chandira, justice S S Sundar had recused himself from hearing the case and asked the case to be placed before another bench, as the petitioner Rathinam raised concern over one of the judges hearing the case.

Hence, the case was listed before a division bench of justice R Subramanian and justice N Sathish Kumar. When the case was taken up for hearing on Wednesday, the judges adjourned the hearing to February 18.

Kejriwal and his entire team have been exposed. The people of Delhi will give a suitable reply,” he stated on Twitter.The BJP chief claimed the entire country has seen the “photos of AAP MLA and Delhi minister Imran Hussain with a radical terrorist organisation, People’s Front of India”. “The entire country knows how much damage the activities of PFI have done to the security and pride of the country, but it is surprising that Kejriwal is standing with them,” the BJP chief added.Attacking Kejriwal and his party for “protecting the tukde-tukde gang”, Nadda tweeted, “Kejriwal and his party are protecting the gang who shouted slogans to break India. If he is connected to AAP, he should be given twice the punishment. There should not be any compromise with the nation’s security. I want to tell the home minister not to do any politics over the nation’s security,” he added.

Title: Tiger deaths: Families to be relocated to Thane
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Porvorim: The government is considering voluntary relocation of individuals and families living in and around critical areas of wildlife sanctuaries to circumvent human-wild animal conflict, chief minister Pramod Sawant told the state assembly on Wednesday.

It is one of the many measures planned by the government following the deaths of a tigress and three cubs near Golauli village adjoining Mhadei wildlife sanctuary last month.

“Forest department officials as well activists are in talks with the families to convince them to shift elsewhere. A revenue land in Thane village has been identified to relocate them,” Sawant said while replying to a calling attention motion moved by opposition members. Few BJP MLAs also spoke in support of the motion.

The families have reservation about relocating as they are worried about their livelihoods. The government will built cowsheds for these families, the chief minister said. Seven to eight spots have been identified where few families were found to be living in the wildlife sanctuary, he said.

Sawant said boundaries were not marked after wildlife sanctuaries were declared. “I have given directions to mark village boundaries to avoid man-animal conflict,” he said.

The chief minister rubbished the allegation by former deputy chief minister Vijai Sardesai who said mining lobbies, in league with local politicians, may be at work as they do not want a tiger corridor.

Sawant said police and forest department officials are investigating the incident.

Earlier, leader of opposition Digambar Kamat said the government failed to take immediate action, and the families affected – who lost their cattle in the tiger attacks – did not get compensation.

Sawant said principal chief conservator of forests (PCCF) which earlier did not have powers to pay compensation to affected families, have now been given the authority to do so.

He said the issue has been handled from a “humanitarian aspect” and all measures are being taken to ensure there is no “repeat” of such incidents in the future.

Title: Mumbai traffic cops identify 177 ‘dangerous’ gaps in dividers
Content:
The gaps are a concern for road safety as motorists, particularly two-wheeler riders, use them to take sudden ... Read More

MUMBAI: An exhaustive survey by Mumbai traffic police has found gaps in road dividers at 177 locations across the city, many of them outside commercial establishments. The gaps are a concern for road safety as motorists, particularly two-wheeler riders, use them to take sudden U-turns . The list of all the locations has been sent to BMC. Traffic police said many of the gaps are unauthorized.Personnel from each of the 34 traffic chowkies were asked to inspect dividers in their jurisdictions. As many as 11 gaps were found in the divider near Saifee Hospital at Charni Road. Other locations were Lala Lajpatrai Road near Racecourse, Karnak bridge, Darbhanga House at Pedder Road, Mahalaxmi Junction, near Marathon Heights at Worli, Nanavati Hospital at Vile Parle, outside Oshiwara and Samta Nagar police stations and IIT-Bombay market gate, among others.“There are multiple gaps on Bhulabhai Desai Road. Besides being dangerous, it leads to big jams. It is also the main cause for delaying ambulances,” said Dinesh Joshi, a south Mumbai resident.“The function of every gap has to be defined and design interventions made. If a gap is not carefully designed, it puts the user in direct conflict with oncoming vehicles,” said Dhawal Ashar, a transport planner. Ex-corporator Nicholas Almeida recalled a 2016 case where a gap outside a bar was filled, at the owner’s request, as a BMC school was on the opposite side of the road. With the closure, the distance between the two increased to 150 metres, more than that required for excise licence.

Title: BJP official files plaint against Rohan
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Panaji: BJP spokesperson Premanand Mahambre on Wednesday filed a complaint with the assembly speaker and Porvorim police alleging that he was heckled by Porvorim MLA Rohan Khaunte in the assembly complex for addressing a press conference earlier in the day against the Independent MLA.

Addressing a press conference late evening, BJP state president Sadanand Tanavade demanded necessary action against Khaunte.

Mahambre, who had addressed a press conference earlier in the day making allegations against Khaunte, said that the Independent MLA got into an altercation with him in the corridors of the assembly complex after the day’s proceedings were over.

While Tanavade said Khaunte is frustrated as he is out of power, Khaunte said BJP is frustrated as he and other opposition members had exposed the BJP government on various issues, including on mismanagement state’s finances. “These are BJP’s old tactics to level false allegations against opponents and to pressurise them into silence,” Khaunte said.

Title: Jagat Prakash Nadda: Sharjeel Imam’s arrest foiled Arvind Kejriwal’s plans
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

NEW DELHI: BJP chief Jagat Prakash Nadda on Tuesday accused Delhi chief minister Arvind Kejriwal of sending a party worker to fire at Shaheen Bagh when his plans were allegedly foiled with the arrest of Sharjeel Imam , in whose favour the CM had made a political move.

The remarks came in the wake of Shaheen Bagh shooter Kapil Baisla being identified as an AAP worker in the course of investigation by Delhi Police.

With a series of tweets, Nadda launched an attack on Kejriwal, accusing the AAP chief of playing with the nation’s security. “People of Delhi and the country have seen the dirty face of the Aam Aadmi Party. For political longing, Kejriwal and his leaders sold the country’s security. Earlier, Kejriwal used to insult the Army and advocate for terrorists, but now AAP’s relations with those who carry out terrorist activities have also come to light,” the BJP chief tweeted.

The BJP chief claimed the entire country has seen the “photos of AAP MLA and Delhi minister Imran Hussain with a radical terrorist organisation, People’s Front of India”. “The entire country knows how much damage the activities of PFI have done to the security and pride of the country, but it is surprising that Kejriwal is standing with them,” the BJP chief added.

Title: Fuel outlet staff murder: Five special teams formed to nab culprits
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Representative image

VILLUPURAM: A day after a petrol outlet worker was murdered in a crude bomb and sickle attack in an alleged case of mistaken identity, the Villupuram district police, who collected CCTV camera footage from the spot, said the assailant who barged into the petrol pump office cabin was accused person Azhar, a notorious anti-social, and formed five special teams to apprehend the gang members behind the attack.

A police team also seized a car abandoned by the gang at Perangiyur on Chennai-Trichy national highway on Tuesday evening and retrieved blood-stained clothes and the sickle used by Azhar dumped in the vehicle before it was abandoned near the Thennpennai riverbank.

Police on Wednesday received a complaint regarding the murder from D Balasundaram, 24, a diesel pump operator and eyewitness. Based on this, the Villupuram taluk police registered a case under several sections against accused Azhar alias Emam ali, 26, a close associate of Irusappan, 48, another anti-social.

According to inspector Robinson, the investigation officer in the case, in 2018, the victim Srinivasan’s co-brother Prakash, who was the owner of the petrol pump (Nagalakshmi Petro Fuels) located at Kamban Nagar, was issued a death threat by Azhar demanding Rs 20 lakh.

Despite several warnings by the gang of racketeers, Prakash told police about the extortion bid, enraging Azhar, who hurled a crude bomb on his neighbor’s house mistaking it to be Prakash’s residence. Though two of his associates were arrested, Azhar was absconding. To avenge the 2018 incident, Azhar who decided to murder Prakash, mistakenly killed his co-brother Srinivasan on Tuesday. Speaking to TOI, SP S Jayakumar said based on Balasundaram’s complaint, police booked a case against Azhar and his associates under Sections 147, 148, 449, 506(ii), 302 of IPC and Section 3 and 4(a) of the Explosive Substance Act, 1908.

“We have formed five special teams and based on reliable information, a hunt is on in places, including Dindugal, Chengalpet and its surrounding areas. The accused would be arrested at the earliest,” he said.

Title: Despite economic slowdown, infra projects did not suffer: Goa CM
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Pramod Sawant in assembly

PORVORIM: Chief minister Pramod Sawant on Wednesday said that the economic slowdown had resulted in reduced tourist footfalls to the state, but despite financial difficulties the state government ensured that there was no shortage of funds for infrastructure projects.

Responding to criticism from the opposition, he said “I have completed 10 months as CM. There are works pending for 15 to 20 years. But it is portrayed as if all these issues have arisen only in the last few months.”

By May 2021, the state government will meet requirements of individual toilets and, by March 2020, 100% of Goa will receive potable water supply, Sawant said replying to a three-day discussion on motion of thanks to governor ’s address.

On enforcing the GST regimen, Sawant said the government is set to adopt a very strict attitude. “There is repeated criticism of GST and VAT collection. Even now many who have business turnover of more than Rs 40 lakh have not registered. We want to tighten enforcement in the next two months. We will not think twice before imposing fines on such businessmen,” he said.

The chief minister said that nearly all tourism-related infrastructure projects are nearing completion in the coastal belt. “We are looking to resolve the taxi issue through GoaMiles. People are appreciating GoaMiles. We still need to further tighten the security for tourists,” Sawant said.

With respect to keeping the drug trade under check, he said that Goa being a touristic state it makes the task a bigger challenge as “it is not possible to check each one entering the state”.

“I am not saying there is no drugs trade. Because it is present, it is being caught. We are also disposing it immediately now and under proper monitoring. Earlier drugs seized would remain even up to two years. ANC is very sensitive to drug-related matters. I have told them that they have to be stricter,” Sawant said.

He asked the people to be vigilant when employing migrants as records showed that 85% of the crimes in the state were committed by them. “We need migrants to do our work,” the chief minister said.

On repairing roads, an issue that drew the government a lot of flak, he said that all remaining repair works will be completed by April-May.

He said the super speciality and cancer hospitals will be completed at the earliest. “We have decided to do major changes in education, like introducing post graduate for courses like architecture. Also, through GIPPARD we will train government staff,” he said.

Speaking about the anti-CAA comments made by some MLAs during the discussions in the House, Sawant said, “I was born in Cotombi. I am not born in a foreign country. We should keep the sanctity of this House.

Title: With 225 species Mandsaur may have a bird sanctuary
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Thousands of birds of 225 species were sighted in the area

INDORE: Thousands of birds of at least 225 species have found Mandsaur ’s Gandhi Sagar area as their preferred home this season. Presence of such large number of species of birds has prompted district administration to explore ways to develop the area as a bird sanctuary.

“In recent past, Gandhi Sagar area has witnessed arrival of large number of birds due to availability of water and wide range of flora and fauna. In the second survey by experts, presence of local and migratory birds of 225 species have been identified,” collector Manoj Pushp told TOI.

In the survey carried out between January 31 and February 2, around 125 ornithologists from across the country, did the bird count. Under guidance of forest officials, they were divided into 24 teams for counting of birds from 6am to 6pm in different parts of Gandhi Sagar wildlife sanctuary. During the survey, species including Indian spotted creeper, black-capped kingfisher, black-necked stork, dunlin, common rosefinch and other ‘rare’ birds were spotted.

“Mandsaur has huge potential to be developed as a major tourist destination due to Gandhi Sagar Dam, wildlife sanctuary, monuments of archaeological importance, historic buildings and religious structures along with Pashupatinath temple. But in absence of direct connectivity of airlines and other modes of transportation, it could not be explored much,” said Mandsaur collector Manoj Pushp.

He hopes that Delhi-Mumbai Expressway, which will pass through Mandsaur, will help in overall development of the district. Buoyed up by passing of Delhi-Mumbai Expressway from the district, the administration has already sent a proposal to the cultural department to develop Gandhi Sagar-Dharmrajeshwar Circuit and Pashupatinath Circuit.

Arrival of large number of locals and migratory birds in Mandsaur has boosted their morale to develop the place as a major tourist destinations. “Besides development of Gandhi Sagar-Dharmrajeshwar Circuit and Pashupatinath Circuit as major tourist destinations, we are encouraging local businessmen and investors to develop projects like resorts, hotels, recreation centres alongside the proposed expressway. A survey of structures of historical and archaeological importance is also underway for their conservation with the help of locals,” Pushp said.

Title: Class IX girl only student from Tamil Nadu, Puducherry and Andamans NCC in all India cultural team
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Shirley Cinderella

PUDUCHERRY: A Class IX girl from Kendriya Vidyalaya Jipmer campus, Shirley Cinderella, was the only student from Tamil Nadu , Puducherry and Andaman & Nicobar NCC directorate selected for the all India cultural team that performed before Prime Minister Narendra Modi and President Ram Nath Kovind in New Delhi.

Shirley was also a part of the ballet team, which bagged gold medal, national integration awareness program, which bagged second prize and dance team, which bagged third prize at the Republic Day celebrations in New Delhi. She was among those felicitated by lieutenant governor Kiran Bedi at Raj Nivas.

An active member of the NCC unit of the school, she was bestowed with the rank of CPL (Corporal) taking the responsibility of training the cadets in the unit. The only daughter of A Mohamed Saleem, CPI Puducherry state secretary and Marie Stella, an associate professor (dance) in Thanjavur University, Shirley excelled in academics, music, yoga, acrobatics and other extracurricular activities.

She clinched national level medals in yoga championships for three consecutive years, silver in 2018 and bronze medals in 2017 and 2016. An accomplished Bharatanatyam dancer, she cleared the highest examination (grade 8) conducted by Trinity College, London. She has also cleared the highest examination (grade 8) in Carnatic flute from the same college. She has cleared grade 4 in piano. She will be appearing for grade 8 in the western recorder, a woodwind musical instrument and for grade 6 in keyboard shortly.

She said her parents were the inspiration to join the NCC. “My parents inspired me to join the NCC. Both were active NCC cadets during their school days. My mother bagged several medals,” said Shirley. She aspires to join the Indian foreign service. “It is a great honour to represent the country in the global platform,” she said.

Unlike most parents, Shirley’s parents never impose their views, thoughts or dreams on her. “I have been attending several camps in Puducherry, Chennai and Delhi and simultaneously training for the cultural events for the Republic Day celebrations in the last four months. I did not attend school in the last four months. My parents did not curb my freedom and they encouraged me to pursue my passion,” she said.

“She is not an average child. She is extraordinary. She excels in different varied disciplines be it dance, music, yoga, acrobatics, academics and scouts. Our duty is to support and guide her,” said Marie Stella.

Title: ‘Need to involve locals in Nagpur’s development’
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Should road and bridge construction agencies do a traffic survey before constructing a new one?

Yes, of course. Before commencing any project, each concerned government agency should do a proper planning and survey. Many projects have come up in the city without proper planning and survey. It is general problem in Nagpur. Not only surveys, even planning for any project is not being done properly.

Should this survey be made public and, suggestions and objections be invited on it even from the traffic police?

There should be public participation in the planning process. Whenever any development plan is prepared there are a lot of provisions which are not disclosed to common public. When the Munje Road was widened under IRDP project, there was a provision in the development plan to make the Sitabuldi main road only for pedestrians. But it was neither implemented nor disclosed. Had citizens been involved, ill-planned infrastructure work could have been averted.

How does one stop construction of ill-planned roads and bridges ?

Civilized and developed countries have a planning department which help in planning roads, gardens, flyovers etc. Sadly, Nagpur city has no proper town planning department. NMC’s town planning department functions only for the sake of sanctioning maps. To stop ill-planned projects, first we need a town planner’s office in every city like Nagpur.

MahaMetro will demolish the station road flyover for road widening. The money spent on its construction will go waste. Who is responsible for this loss?

During early 2000, there was no development works going on in the city. So the flyover was accepted by all. If something happens everybody is ready to support. The attitude of citizens is responsible for the ill-planned development. City is witnessing ad hoc planning. Cement road construction is another glaring example which is causing floods across the city. The root cause of ill-planned structures like the flyover in front of railway station is that bureaucrats cannot defy the diktats of politicians.

Can you suggest solutions to solve the traffic mess created due to unscientific construction of Sadar flyover, Ram Jhula, road through Central Jail etc?

Nowadays, everyone is working to expedite the completion of a project. There has to be a comprehensive plan for any project. Already international and Indian standards are in place there but, ironically, none of the agencies follows them. Once constructed without proper planning, any project be it Sadar flyover, there is no solution to rectify the mistake. The only solution is to involve citizens and organizations like Institution of Engineers or premier educational institutions like VNIT before commencing any project.

(Avantika Chitnavis is a city architect)

Title: Shaheen Bagh Protest: Shaheen Bagh shooter’s kin asked by cops to join probe
Content:
Police suspect Kapil Baisla was using another phone

NEW DELHI: The Special Investigation Team of Crime Branch has sent a notice to the father and brother of Kapil Baisla, the Shaheen Bagh shooter , to join the probe. After giving a video statement on Tuesday, Baisla’s father, Gaje Singh, and brother switched off their mobile phones and refused to join the investigation. It was found that the phone from which police had recovered the photographs of Baisla and his father joining AAP had only a handful of numbers saved, mostly belonging to his friends.Police suspect he was using another phone, which he did not mention during interrogation. Cops has been focusing on the WhatsApp group which he was a part of. The group’s details have been retrieved and members who made objectionable statements will be called in for questioning.Sources said during his questioning on Wednesday, Baisla kept evading questions regarding the reason behind the firing. He kept changing his statement on his association with the group, whose members wanted to act against the anti-CAA protesters. “His versions are being put on record,” said a police officer.Baisla’s friend, Sarthak, was arrested and questioned. His statements were found to be contradictory. Baisla was taken to Shaheen Bagh on the route he had travelled to establish his claims.Cops are trying to establish a conspiracy since Baisla claimed that he had bought the weapon seven years ago, but couldn’t identify the seller. He kept changing his statement regarding the identity of the arms dealer. A manhunt has been launched to track down the dealers named by him.Meanwhile, reacting to the allegations of violating the model code of conduct, a senior police officer said that some facts related to Baisla emerged during the course of investigation. On queries by the media, the officer concerned addressed the facts, which were also informed to the court. The remand copy, that was allegedly circulated, is a judicial document. Delhi Police maintained that it wasn’t shared by any officer in the public domain.In Video: My son is ‘sevak’ of PM Modi, Amit Shah: Father of Shaheen Bagh shooter

Title: Amendment to co-op societies bill passed
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Panaji: The assembly on Wednesday passed the Goa Cooperative Societies (Amendment) Bill, 2020. Chief minister Pramod Sawant, responding to apprehensions by Curtorim MLA Aleixo Reginaldo Lourenco, said that the amendment was only to allow a member of the apex cooperative body to serve on the primary body in a managerial position as well.

Reginaldo said that administrative issues have already adversely affected many cooperative societies in the state.

Cooperation minister Govind Gaude earlier introduced the Goa Cooperative Societies (Amendment) Bill, 2020, which omits the fourth proviso to sub-section of Section 59 of the Goa Cooperative Societies Act.

It enables the board of directors of the apex or federal co-operative society to also enjoy managerial rights in an individual capacity over such primary cooperative society.

Title: Kerala: After ‘cocktail’ hangover, excise gets its act together
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Excise officials had dumped 4,500L of ‘illegal’ liquor into a pit, unaware that there was a well nearby.

Title: Hyderabad Metro yet to clear Rs 60 lakh licence fee
Content:
Representative image

SECUNDERABAD: With arrangements being made to commence commercial operations for the Metro rail corridor between Jubilee Bus Station (JBS) and Mahatma Gandhi Bus Station (MGBS) on February 7, instances of Hyderabad Metro Rail Limited ( HMRL ) defaulting on payment of licence fee have come to light.Secunderabad defence authorities are yet to receive over Rs 60 lakh as annual licence fee from HMRL. As per the agreement between HMRL and defence authorities, HMRL has to pay an annual licence fee to utilise defence land on two stretches to construct pillars and lay rail lines.L&T HMRL had built elevated metro rail corridors by constructing pillars on two stretches (old) Begumpet airport entrance to ISKCON and from Jubilee Bus Station to YMCA X roads that fall within defence jurisdiction. The stretch between Begumpet and ISKCON is already in use while operations on second stretch are set to begin on February 7.As per the official website of Director General Defence Estates (DGDE), if defence land is allowed to be occupied on lease or licence basis, the market value of land is assessed by a committee consisting of the defence estates officer. The Standard Table of Rents (STRs) are revised annually in fast developing Cantonments such as the Secunderabad Cantonment and triennially for other Cantonments. The same rules were applied to the deal given to HMRL and each year defence estates office serves a demand notice to HMRL regarding payment of licence fee.“HMRL has paid annual licence fee till June 2018 but payments are due for the year 2019,” a highly placed source in defence estate office told TOI.A demand notice has been served to HMRL authorities to furnish all the details such as length of two stretches and its jurisdiction and revised ‘standard table of rents’ (STR) stipulated by the Director General Defence Estates (DGDE).The notice also stated that HMRL had to make the payment by June 2019. But HMRL has not responded to the notice, said sources.

Title: Water from Sathanur dam released for irrigation
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Representative image

TIRUVANNAMALAI: Sevoor S Ramachandran, TN minister for Hindu Religious and Charitable Endowments (HRCE) department, on Wednesday released water from Sathanur dam to irrigate cultivable land through the left and right bank canals of the dam.

According to a press release from the Tiruvannamalai collector’s office, the total height of Sathanur dam was 119 ft and it has a capacity of 7,321 million cubic feet. As on Wednesday, the water level was at 97.60 ft, with a storage of 3,413 million cubic feet.

Acceding to the request of farmers and to benefit about 7,543 acres of agricultural land relying on the dam, about 100 cusecs and 150 cusecs of water will be released from the left and right bank canals of the dam for 35 days (from February 5 to March 10), the release said.

Title: Following protest, Goa CM refers ESMA bill to select committee
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Goa's chief minister Pramod Sawant

PORVORIM: Following objections from the opposition benches, chief minister Pramod Sawant on Wednesday agreed to refer the amendment to the Goa Essential Services Maintenance Bill, 2020, to a select committee.

Sawant made the announcement after opposition members said the purpose of the amendments — an increase in jail term from 6 months to 3 years — was not clear.

“Why don’t you send it to a select committee? Increasing jail term for ESMA violations from six months to three years absolutely sends a wrong message to society,” said leader of opposition Digambar Kamat. “What is its purpose, I don’t know. How many persons arrested under the act till now were kept in jail even for ten days or a month? Even recently, those arrested for a bus strike were released within a night.”

Ponda MLA Ravi Naik said that if a government servant is kept in jail for three years for violation of ESMA, it is not clear whether or not their job would remain at the end of this period.

Porvorim MLA Rohan Khaunte said that sending the bill to a select committee will help understand the purpose of the amendments proposed in the bill. “Necessary laws like the Panchayat Act, etc, are not being passed. What is the purpose of pushing this bill first, and in such a hurry?” Khaunte asked.

The bill proposes amendments to Sections 4, 5 and 6 of the Goa Essential Services Maintenance Act. The amendments are to increase the punishment provided in the sections to a three-year jail term and a minimum fine of Rs 5,000, for violating provisions of the ESMA Act.

The bill states that the amendment is “so as to have a deterrent effect and for the prevention of offences”. It also proposes an amendment to Section 9 of the principal act, making the offence cognisable and non-bailable.

Title: Police to match voice samples of Sharjeel with clips of speeches
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Sharjeel Imam

NEW DELHI: Delhi Police has taken the voice samples of Sharjeel Imam and would match them with the videos of his speeches at Shaheen Bagh and Aligarh. The samples will be used to analyse some phone recordings and voice chats as part of a probe to ascertain his role during the clashes at Shaheen Bagh.

His social media profiles are, meanwhile, being scanned to identify his associates. The special investigation team is also probing his association with groups like Popular Front of India and Islamic Youth Federation.

During interrogation, Sharjeel mentioned the names of three of his associates, who helped him in his research before he gave the speeches at Jamia and Aligarh universities. Efforts are being made to track down his associates, including a former classmate.

Sharjeel had earlier claimed that he was inspired by some social theories based on a 1890 document. He felt the policies of the government were against his communities. He went ahead with his activities despite being aware that he might land up in jail on sedition charges, sources added.

During the interrogation on Thursday, the cops recorded Sharjeel’s voice samples and sent them for an analysis. They would be matched with that of the videos. The videos of his speeches have been sent to Central Forensic Science Laboratory for an authenticity verification.

Sharjeel is also being questioned by the cops about the friends, who helped him evade the police during the raids.

Title: CMCH gets nod to perform liver, heart transplants
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Representative image

The transplant authority of Tamil Nadu has given permission to the Coimbatore Medical College Hospital (CMCH) to perform liver and heart transplants. Now that the hospital has performed its first cadaver harvest surgery, it plans to start liver transplant programme as well soon. The hospital had applied for permission to start liver transplants in 2018-end.

Speaking to TOI, dean of the hospital Dr B Ashokan said the liver from the donor, Siva Perumal, had been allotted to a patient in Kovai Medical Centre and Hospital, because the donor’s blood group did not match with those of their liver failure patients. “We started our liver treatment programme around a year back, and some of our patients have also been put on TRANSTAN waiting list. However, the top patient who was ready did not match with the donor, so we had to give away the liver,” he said. “However, we hope that the next time we get a cadaver organ harvesting in our hospital, we can retain the liver for our own patients,” he added.

Liver transplants in the district and region are only being performed by private hospitals. “We have well-equipped intensive care units, ventilators, staff and surgeons who have trained at Stanley Medical College and under liver transplant expert Dr Mohammed Rela himself. We have created an exclusive ICU for liver transplant patients to prevent the risk of infections,” said Dr Ashokan, during an earlier interaction with TOI.

The GH performing transplants is critical, because a liver transplant costs at least Rs 25 lakh in private hospitals and a kidney transplant costs Rs 3.5 lakh. Though both procedures are covered by the Tamil Nadu Comprehensive Health Insurance Scheme, many hospitals perform very few procedures under the government insurance. “The state insurance scheme rarely covers 75% of all costs incurred, and we are not allowed to demand extra payments also. So, we have a limit on the number of cases done under the insurance scheme and some patients have to be refused because of it,” said a coordinator of a multi-specialty hospital on Avinashi Road.

Title: Mangaluru: Green signal for mayoral polls
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

The mayor will now be a candidate from BCM ‘A’ category and deputy mayor a woman from the general category

MANGALURU: The urban development department has cleared the decks for the election of a new city mayor. A direction from the principal secretary to the commissioner, Mangaluru City Corporation, on February 3, to proceed with the election to the post of mayor and deputy mayor as per the reservation roster for the 21st term dated September 3, 2018, has set to rest doubts about confusion that prevailed on the roster that the civic body had to follow.

Accordingly, the mayor will now be a candidate from BCM ‘A’ category and deputy mayor a woman from the general category.

The February 3 letter reminded Shanady Ajith Kumar Hegde , the commissioner, that the civic body was yet to conduct an election for the posts as per the roster for the 21st term, and the same must be followed. The principal secretary also directed Hegde to take steps to ensure that the elections to the posts are conducted forthwith.

The confusion arose when the BJP government on December 26, 2019, issued the reservation roster for the post of mayor and deputy mayor for 11 city corporations, including Mangaluru, for the 22nd term. The officials were in a dilemma on going ahead with the elections with the reservation that reserved the post of mayor for the general category and that of deputy mayor for general woman candidate, as MCC was yet to hold elections as per the roster for the 21st term.

Ajith Kumar Hegde said based on directions from the principal secretary, MCC on Tuesday has written a letter to the regional commissioner, Mysuru, to fix the date for the elections. It is now up to the regional commissioner to take forward the election process, he said.

BJP swept the elections to the 60-member council held on November 12, winning 44 wards and relegating the ruling Congress to 14 wards. Social Democratic Party of India won two seats.

Dr Y Bharath Shetty , Mangaluru City North MLA, told TOI that the party will take a call on the mayoral candidate once the regional commissioner notifies the election date. Asserting that no names have been finalised, Dr Shetty said the party will strive to meet the assurances given to the electorate in the party manifesto, and provide a clean and transparent administration. This is for the second time in MCC’s history that the BJP has come to power.

Title: Wife’s suicide: 10-year rigorous imprisonment for man
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Representative image

COIMBATORE: The mahila court on Wednesday sentenced a 35-year-old man to 10 years rigorous imprisonment for abetting the suicide of his wife in 2013.

Police identified him as S Shanmuganandam of Nandha Nagar in Singanallaur. “He had married Sujatha in 2007. Following a quarrel in March 2013, Sujatha left her husband and, along with their child, began to stay with her parents at their house at Gandhi Managar in the city. Shanmuganandam had been forcing her to bring the child to meet his parents. She was frustrated by the constant pestering and was not able to concentrate on her job. On April 26, 2013, Sujatha was waiting at the Nava India bus stop near Peelamedu to catch a bus to her home. Shanmuganandam called her in her mobile phone and again forced her to bring their child. She had a quarrel with him,” a police officer said.

A depressed Sujatha consumed cow dung powder, a poisonous synthetic dye used as a colouring agent, right at the bus stop. Though she was admitted to a private hospital in the area, she passed away on May 2.

Based on her account, the Coimbatore all women police filed a case against Shanmuganandam for abetting Sujatha’s suicide and arrested him.

On Wednesday, mahila court judge J Radhika awarded 10 years rigorous imprisonment to Shanmuganandam and also slapped him with a fine of Rs 5,000.

Title: CMCH performs first cadaver organ harvest, donation
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Representative image

COIMBATORE: For the first time, the Coimbatore Medical College Hospital (CMCH) on Wednesday declared a patient brain dead and harvested his organs.

The donor patient, a 35-year-old man from Kattabettu in the Nilgiris, had fallen from the top of his under-construction house.

While the CMCH doctors transplanted a kidney into one of their kidney failure patients, the other kidney was donated to a patient in Salem Government Hospital and liver was donated to a private hospital in the city.

Though doctors at CMCH began performing live donor kidney transplants in 2017, they are yet to perform a cadaver transplant as they are yet to harvest organs from a brain-dead patient. However, doctors at Salem GH have had performed first organ harvest on January 21 this year.

Welcoming the first cadaver organ transplant in CMCH, a senior health department official said, “It is critical that government hospitals perform organ harvests, because this way even poor people can access cadaver organs. Only when a GH declares brain death and donates organs, will more organs circulate in the government hospital pool benefitting poor patients.”

CMCH dean Dr B Ashokan said they received a 35-year-old male patient referred from Ooty on February 2. “He had fallen accidentally from a height in his house and suffered head injuries. He was referred to CMCH after being given first aid in a nearby hospital,” he said. “Despite our neurology team treating him, he did not respond,” he said. On Tuesday morning, 48 hours after the accident, doctors performed the first sleep apnea test. By evening, they performed the second test again which elicited no response. The doctors declared him brain dead on Tuesday evening. The hospital’s grief counsellor, appointed by MOHAN foundation, Nishanth, first informed their family and broached the subject of organ donation. The patient’s wife and relatives agreed, said the hospital’s medical superintendent.

The Tamil Nadu Transplant Authority (TRANSTAN) was then informed. They allotted one kidney to a patient in CMCH waiting for a donor, another kidney to a patient in Salem GH and liver to Kovai Medical Centre and Hospital.

Since it was an accidental death and a medico-legal case, it became an uphill task for the authorities to get nod from the Nilgiris police for organ harvest and post-mortem.

The organ harvest surgery began at 11am. By 2pm, the three organs and cornea were harvested. Police organized green corridors CMCH to KMCH and Salem GH. “This is the first time we are harvesting cadaver organs. We hope this is the start of a successful cadaver organ harvest and transplant program,” Dr Ashokan said.

Title: SCB elections deferred as MoD extends tenure in 55 Cantt Boards
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Representative image

SECUNDERABAD: Putting an end to uncertainty over the extension of term of the existing Secunderabad Cantonment Board ( SCB ) elected body, Ministry of Defence (MoD) issued orders on Wednesday, stating that the tenure has been extended for another six months.

Rajesh Kumar Sah, deputy director, D(Q&C), Department of Defence in an official communiqué said that it is not possible to hold elections in Cantonment Boards due to administrative reasons and that the Central government has extended the term of offices of all elected members of 55 Cantonment Boards. The extension period will last for six months or till the date of constitution of the Board (whichever is earlier).

Due to the extension, election in eight civilian SCB wards has been deferred. The MoD was supposed to issue an election notification this week for the ensuing elections, said officials.

Cantonment Board officials had completed the process of ward reservation as well as updation of voters’ list nearly two months ago.

Welcoming MoD’s decision on the extension of tenure for another six months, SCB vice president, J Ramakrishna said, “We will complete all pending works in our respective wards.”

“With the extension of the tenure, the MoD gave scope to the present elected body to take up various developmental activities in all eight Cantonment Board wards,” said J Surana, vice president, All India Cantonments Residential Welfare Associations.
