Meanwhile, few current ward members said that though they welcome the MoD’s decision to extend the tenure, it is upsetting that the announcement was made much after preparations for elections began. Members said that as they had started campaigning, the decision came as a shock.

Title: 81 teenagers give up on life in 5 years in Chandigarh
Content:
Representative image

CHANDIGARH: As many as 81 teenagers reportedly committed suicide from January 2015 to December 31, 2019, in the city, in grim figures that have prompted experts to ask parents, teachers, siblings and friends to look out for warning signs like poor eating habits, depression, short temper and mood swings.Multiple reasons are cited for children taking the drastic step. Dr B S Chavan, psychiatrist, Government Medical College and Hospital, Sector 32, lists six — academic pressure, frequent break-ups in relationships, poor tolerance and aggression, parents not paying attention, alcohol abuse and easy access to means of suicide, like firearms. Professor Adarsh Kohli, a clinical psychologist, PGI, called frustration owing to unfulfilled ambitions and failed relationships the key reasons behind teen suicides — the most (25) took place in 2017.Eighteen children took their lives in 2015, 11 in 2016, 12 in 2018 and 15 last year, according to the data. As many as 39 victims were in the age group of 16 to 18 years, 27 in the 14 to 16, 11 in the 12 to 14 and four in the 8 to 12 age bracket, police said. Hanging was the most common mode followed by consuming poisonous substances and jumping into lake or buildings. Experts said schools can play a major role in detecting whether a child is troubled or not.On its part, the UT administration has appointed counsellors in government schools to help students cope up with exam stress and observe the signs of suicides or stress. Prabhjot Kaur, a counsellor in a government school, said they regularly give special lectures to students of classes V to XII on stress management and monitor each one of them. During parent-teacher meetings, parents are told about not putting undue pressure on their wards for studies, she said. Counsellors said they also receive cases of bullying among the students by their classmates or friends. Bullying leads to distress and anxiety among children and can drive some of the children to suicide, experts said.A few years back, an online game was blamed for a number of suicides among children in the country. In Blue Whale challenge, a designated curator assigns players various tasks over a 50-day period, culminating in the player committing suicide. However, no confirmed case of a child ending his life after playing the game had been officially reported in the Tricity. In Panchkula, a 15-year-old girl had allegedly set herself on fire at a park in Sector 7. Police had not ruled out online suicide game angle in the case. Police had sent her mobile phone to a laboratory in Gurugram to unlock it to obtain clues that could help them unravel the mysterious case — the girl had carried a brand new knife in her purse, took a solo and risky trip to a town in Himachal Pradesh at night and the manner in which she decided to end her life.MAIN CASESJanuary 23, 2020 | A 17-year-old Class XII student allegedly committed suicide by shooting himself with his father’s pistol at his house in Phase X, Mohali. He was reportedly depressedSeptember 1, 2019 | As 16-year-old boy and girl allegedly committed suicide by consuming poison at Botanical Garden in Sarangpur. Both were in love and wanted to marry, a choice their parents were againstMay 4, 2019 | A 17-year-old Class XII student had committed suicide by jumping into Sukhna Lake after failing in two subjects. The victim belonged to Kangra in Himachal Pradesh

Title: Rahul Gandhi targets PM, CM; says youth of India is afraid
Content:
ALL-OUT ATTACK: Priyanka Gandhi Vadra said she got late in joining Rahul Gandhi at Hauz Qazi because AAP and B... Read More

NEW DELHI: Former Congress president Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday said that while India’s youth demanded employment, progress and development, Prime Minister Narendra Modi got them beaten up and shot by police.While canvassing for Alka Lamba , the party candidate in Chandni Chowk, Gandhi told a gathering at Hauz Qazi that if India and Delhi weren’t developed as manufacturing hubs of the world and didn’t provide employment to the youth, then violence and hate would soon be 10 times greater than the current levels.He said that in another year, a never-heard-before voice would emerge and “ask Narendra Modi to stand aside and give employment to the youth. Only then will India get back on the right track”.He added: “The only challenge before India is employment generation and, for this, we’ll have to dislodge both (Delhi CM Arvind) Kejriwal and Narendra Modi. This can only be done if Hindus, Muslims, Sikhs and Christians stick together.”Gandhi claimed that Modi spent all his time creating divisions. “And, then, he claims to be a deshbhakt,” he said. “Kejriwal and Modi teach us patriotism. Who are they teaching us deshbhakti? The country elected them to work and they failed completely.” He claimed that Modi’s entire politics fed on the oxygen of unemployment.Taking a dig at finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman, he said her 2.5-hour-long Budget speech was full of lies. “There are only two people who can speak endless lies. They are Kejriwal and Modi,” he said.Gandhi said the people of India could get angry with each other, but there was no hate. “There is a difference between gussa and nafrat. There was no hate between Hindus and Muslims between 2004 and 2014. Then Narendra Modi comes from Gujrat and spreads the poison everywhere.”He also raked up the controversy around PM’s degree. “While Modi teaches kids on how to clear exams through events such as Pariksha Pe Charcha, he also refuses to show his own degree to the nation,” he said.Priyanka Gandhi Vadra, who got delayed in joining her brother at Hauz Qazi, said she was late because BJP-AAP made no new roads. “If I had taken Sheila ji ki metro, I would have arrived in 10 minutes,” she said.Vadra said that Delhites had an important decision to make. “Delhi is India’s heart. You fought for independence and helped create the Constitution. This is a garden, you are the gardener and all types of flowers blossom here. This government wants to destroy the garden,” she said. “Earlier, we had slogans like jai jawan, jai kisan. Today we have goli maro... khoon se tilak karo.”She also presented a comparative report card of Congress and AAP and claimed that the former had outperformed on all parameters.Earlier, at a gathering in east Delhi’s Kondli, Gandhi claimed that he hadn’t uttered a single lie in his 15-year political career. “You will not find a single lie in Rahul Gandhi’s speeches. But, listen to Modi ji or Kejriwal and you will find lies. Don’t even listen to Amit Shah” he said. “The atmosphere has worsened in the last five years. What is the reason? Many will say it’s Modi or BJP . I will say the biggest reason is that the youth of India is unable to see the right path. He is afraid. He is afraid of unemployment,” Gandhi said.

Title: Call for participation in survey
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Coimbatore: The city corporation has taken to the social media, including Twitter, to request the public to participate in the ministry of housing and urban affairs’ ‘Ease of Living Index', a citizen perception survey. The civic body is also planning to distribute pamphlets to the public.

People can scan the QR code on the pamphlet or visit http://eol2019.org/Citizen and answer a set of 24 questions about transportation, law and order, infrastructure, education and healthcare facilities available in the city. It will be open till February 29.

The annual survey is conducted to rank cities selected under the central government’s smart cities mission based on parameters such as governance, healthcare, education, security, economy, pollution, water supply, transport, power, housing, wastewater and solid waste management, among others. Coimbatore was ranked 25 in the index in 2018.

Title: 2 spl trains from Sec’bad to cater to passenger rush
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Secunderabad: South Central Railway will run four special trains between Secunderabad and Kakinada town, and Secunderabad and Tirupati to clear rush of extra passengers.

The trains will have AC II tier, AC III tier,and sleeper class coaches. While train no 07001 07002 will ply to and from Kakinada, train no 07429 , 07430 will ply to and from Triupati. TNN

Title: Bodies of 2 baby girls found in drain, garbage
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Chandigarh: The bodies of two newborn baby girls were found dumped in a drain and a garbage heap in two cases in the city on Wednesday.

Police said municipal corporation employees had gone to clear a blocked drain near the community centre in Sector 56 around 10.30 am. When they opened the lid, they spotted the body. Cops from Sector 56 police post reached the spot and took the body to Government Multi-specialty Hospital, Sector 16.

Around an hour later, Sector 34 police received a call from a garbage collector about the body of a newborn girl lying in a heap of waste in Sector 33. Police took the body to the mortuary of Government Medical College and Hospital, Sector 32 for autopsy. The post-mortem in both the cases would be conducted on Thursday.

Police suspect the two babies were born around 7 to 15 days back. Police registered a case under Section 318 (concealment of birth by secret disposal of dead body) of IPC against unknown persons and started a probe. Police are checking birth and death records at all government and nearby private hospitals.

CRUEL ACTS

July 2019 | A newborn baby girl was found abandoned on a road side. Police later traced her mother (16-year-old) to Mubarikpur, Derabassi. Police said the abandoned the baby after delivery

June 2018 | The body of a newborn baby girl was found wrapped in a piece of cloth near the bridge in Khuda Lahora

October 2017 | A week-old baby girl was found abandoned in a bucket outside a house in Kajheri

Title: Newly-notified rules for litigants: Madras high court notice on pleas
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Representative image

MADURAI: The Madras high court has ordered notice to the registrar (general) of principal seat and registrar (administration) of the Madurai bench while hearing a batch of petitions, which challenged the newly-notified High Court of Madras (Conduct of Proceedings by Party-In-Person) Rules, 2019.

The petitions were filed by ‘Traffic’ Ramasamy, K K Ramesh and A M Sundaravel who appeared as party-in-persons in several cases.

The petitioners stated that registrar general of Madras high court has put in place new guidelines which were recently notified in the Rules. As per this notification, a person who wants to appear as party-in-person should file an application attested by oath commissioner or notary and the party-in-person committee would scrutinize the papers and take a decision on allowing the person to appear as party-in-person or would offer legal services through the high court legal services committee.

They stated that any litigant has the right to represent himself before the court, however, the newly notified rules attempts to strike out an individual representing himself before the court. They stated that compelling a litigant to engage a lawyer is not correct.

Since these new guidelines would cause several hardships for the people appearing as party-in-persons, the petitioners moved the high court Madurai bench challenging the newly-notified rules.

When the petition was heard on Wednesday, a division bench of justices M Duraiswamy and T Ravindran ordered notice and adjourned the case to a further date for hearing.

Title: Rahul Gandhi: Former Congress President Rahul Gandhi targets PM, CM; says youth of India is afraid
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

ALL-OUT ATTACK: Priyanka Gandhi Vadra said she got late in joining Rahul Gandhi at Hauz Qazi because AAP and B... Read More

NEW DELHI: Former Congress president Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday said that while India’s youth demanded employment, progress and development, Prime Minister Narendra Modi got them beaten up and shot by police.

While canvassing for Alka Lamba , the party candidate in Chandni Chowk, Gandhi told a gathering at Hauz Qazi that if India and Delhi weren’t developed as manufacturing hubs of the world and didn’t provide employment to the youth, then violence and hate would soon be 10 times greater than the current levels.

He said that in another year, a never-heard-before voice would emerge and “ask Narendra Modi to stand aside and give employment to the youth. Only then will India get back on the right track”.

He added: “The only challenge before India is employment generation and, for this, we’ll have to dislodge both (Delhi CM Arvind) Kejriwal and Narendra Modi. This can only be done if Hindus, Muslims, Sikhs and Christians stick together.”

Gandhi claimed that Modi spent all his time creating divisions. “And, then, he claims to be a deshbhakt,” he said. “Kejriwal and Modi teach us patriotism. Who are they teaching us deshbhakti? The country elected them to work and they failed completely.” He claimed that Modi’s entire politics fed on the oxygen of unemployment.

Taking a dig at finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman, he said her 2.5-hour-long Budget speech was full of lies. “There are only two people who can speak endless lies. They are Kejriwal and Modi,” he said.

Gandhi said the people of India could get angry with each other, but there was no hate. “There is a difference between gussa and nafrat. There was no hate between Hindus and Muslims between 2004 and 2014. Then Narendra Modi comes from Gujrat and spreads the poison everywhere.”

He also raked up the controversy around PM’s degree. “While Modi teaches kids on how to clear exams through events such as Pariksha Pe Charcha, he also refuses to show his own degree to the nation,” he said.

Priyanka Gandhi Vadra, who got delayed in joining her brother at Hauz Qazi, said she was late because BJP-AAP made no new roads. “If I had taken Sheila ji ki metro, I would have arrived in 10 minutes,” she said.

Vadra said that Delhites had an important decision to make. “Delhi is India’s heart. You fought for independence and helped create the Constitution. This is a garden, you are the gardener and all types of flowers blossom here. This government wants to destroy the garden,” she said. “Earlier, we had slogans like jai jawan, jai kisan. Today we have goli maro... khoon se tilak karo.”

She also presented a comparative report card of Congress and AAP and claimed that the former had outperformed on all parameters.

Earlier, at a gathering in east Delhi’s Kondli, Gandhi claimed that he hadn’t uttered a single lie in his 15-year political career. “You will not find a single lie in Rahul Gandhi’s speeches. But, listen to Modi ji or Kejriwal and you will find lies. Don’t even listen to Amit Shah” he said. “The atmosphere has worsened in the last five years. What is the reason? Many will say it’s Modi or BJP . I will say the biggest reason is that the youth of India is unable to see the right path. He is afraid. He is afraid of unemployment,” Gandhi said.

Title: Indore: Passenger caught with 612gm gold hidden in speaker, mixer and juicer
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Representative image

INDORE: The Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) Indore Zonal Unit have arrested a passenger , who was trying to smuggle 612 gram of gold at Indore airport .

The passenger identified as Mohammad Vasim had hidden the gold worth Rs 25 lakh in metallic parts of portable speakers and mixer and juicer, an official release issued by DRI on Wednesday stated.

Vasim came to Indore from Dubai on an Air India flight (AI 904) on Tuesday night. He appeared to be suspicious and when the DRI officers searched him they recovered the gold from him. He wanted to carry the gold to New Delhi.

Recent seizures are indicative of increased smuggling of gold from foreign countries more specifically from Dubai.

One of the main reasons behind this is the considerable price difference between Indian and international market price of gold, the DRI said in its release.

This is not the first time when a passenger has been caught with large amount of gold. People come up with novel ways to hide gold. A week ago, the DRI Indore had intercepted a passenger and recovered around half a kilogram of gold from his rectum at Indore airport. He had concealed the gold in his rectum in form of paste capsule. He, too, had arrived from Dubai.

Title: There’s no need to panic over coronavirus, says minister
Content:
District minister Kota Shrinivas Poojari chairs an emergency meeting at the DC’s office in Mangaluru on Wednes... Read More

MANGALURU: In the backdrop of the coronavirus outbreak in China and some reported cases in India, district minister Kota Shrinivas Poojari said that there is no need for the public to panic over the issue, but advised people to take precautionary measures.The minister addressed an emergency meeting at the deputy commissioner’s office on Wednesday. He said that no coronavirus case has been reported in the state so far. Since a case has been reported in neighbouring Kasargod, the district administration has put in place precautionary measures. In case of any doubts, he requested the public to contact the health department helpline number 104. The district administration is prepared to meet any contingency, Poojari said.Deputy commissioner Sindhu B Rupesh said provisions have been made for health checkups at prominent entry points like railway stations and the airport. Since there is no direct flight from China to Mangaluru, there is no reason to panic. However, two people who returned from China recently have undergone health checkups, and no symptoms of the disease were found on them, she said.NMPT officers said that three Chinese nationals were not allowed to alight from the cruise vessel that arrived at the New Mangaluru Port on Tuesday.

Title: TNPSC exam scam: Two, including cop, arrested
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Representative image

CHENNAI: Crime Branch-CID sleuths on Wednesday arrested two people, including a policeman, in connection with the TNPSC exam scam. With the arrest of the policeman in the exam scam, the total number of police personnel arrested in the case has reached three.

However, prime suspect Jayakumar is still on the run even as a special team has fanned out to trace him.

A press release from the Tamil Nadu Crime Branch CID said that the agency on Wednesday arrested policeman T Boopathy, an Armed Reserve constable from Chennai. He had allegedly collected a total of Rs 55 lakh from five people who appeared for the 2017 group 2A TNPSC examination and managed to get them jobs with the help of Jayakumar.

Police had also arrested V Karthik, who had paid Rs 9 lakh through Jayakumar and ‘cleared’ the 2017 exam indulging in malpractice to get appointed in the commercial tax department as an assistant.

The CB-CID further noted that policeman Sithandi, who was arrested from Sivaganga on Tuesday, had collected Rs 82.5 lakh from seven job aspirants who cleared the 2017 group 2A examination and were selected for government jobs then. Similarly, he had collected Rs 7.5 lakh each from 15 people and gave it to Jayakumar. Of the 15, only five were selected.

Meanwhile, the CB-CID intensified its hunt for Jayakumar, believed to be a native of Kerala and had settled in Chennai. Police, who believed that he had gone on pilgrimage, have been looking for him in all the neighbouring states. His photograph was circulated across the state borders.

So far, the Tamil Nadu CB-CID has arrested as many as 32 people in connection with two TNPSC examination scams after the authorities found that candidates who wrote the exam from a particular centre scored high ranks.

TNPSC had banned 99 candidates for life from the Group IV exam after it found that they had manipulated answers by using ‘special’ ink. These candidates from across the state had written the exam at Rameswaram and Keelakkarai centres in Ramanathapuram district as per the instructions of the scamsters. The answer sheets of 52 candidates out of the total 99 were manipulated by the gang who shaded correct responses after the scam.

Title: Madras high court seeks officials’ response in maternal death case
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Representative image

MADURAI: Taking serious note of the dereliction on part of the authorities in the maternal death of a woman at K Pudur urban primary health centre ( UPHC ) in September 2019, the Madras high court has sought explanations from the officials for the delay in informing the reasons to the woman’s husband.

S Manimuthu, a resident of K Pudur in Madurai , in his petition, stated that he got married to Sakthikali, 22, in 2018. After his wife became pregnant, she was going to the K Pudur UPHC for regular check-up. As his wife went into labour, she was admitted at the UPHC at September 14, 2019. The duty doctor who examined her stated that the delivery would be normal and there is no complication.

After the duty doctor left the UPHC premises, his wife started experiencing pain and a nurse examined her. Since the doctor did not come to the UPHC till 11pm, Manimuthu asked the nurse to shift his wife to the Government Rajaji Hospital (GRH), however, no steps were taken by the nurse to shift her.

Later, the nurse called him inside the UPHC and when he went inside, he noticed that his wife was lying in a pool of blood. He immediately rushed her to the GRH in an ambulance, however, the doctors declared that she was brought dead. He stated that based on his complaint, the K Pudur police have registered a case under Section 174 CrPC.

He stated that since his wife and his child died due to the negligence of the doctors, he sent a representation to the authorities concerned seeking to conduct judicial inquiry into his wife’s death. He further stated that the authorities concerned did not take any steps to issue the death certificate and postmortem report in order to bring out the truth and reasons for his wife’s death. He also stated that there was no response for the representation sent to the authorities in this regard.

Since no steps were taken, the petitioner moved the high court Madurai bench in 2019, seeking the state to provide a compensation of Rs 10 lakh as his wife died due to medical negligence. He further sought the authorities to issue the postmortem report and death certificate and also sought action against the duty doctor and nurse of K Pudur UPHC for their medical negligence.

When the petition was taken up for hearing on Tuesday, justice Pushpa Sathyanarayana directed the dean of GRH, multipurpose health supervisor of GRH and inspector of police of K Pudur police station to file an affidavit explaining as to why the reasons for the death of woman was not informed to the petitioner. The case was adjourned to February 11.

Meanwhile, officials had handed over the death certificate to Manimuthu on Tuesday, only after the court took a serious view in this matter.

Title: Telangana: New mayors seek funds for civic work
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Representative image

HYDERABAD: Newly elected mayors of municipal corporations in the state have asked for delegation of powers of various departments such as public health, power and welfare for better administration and have requested for funds for developmental works in their respective municipal corporation limits.

The mayors expressed their views during the state mayors' meeting conducted by the Telangana State's First Finance Commission on Wednesday. Finance commissioner chairman G Rajesham Goud explained to them the finance commission's role in finances and delegation of powers.

The chairman said that after strengthening the local bodies in districts, chief minister K Chandrasekhar Rao is now focussing on urban local bodies by allocating funds to municipalities and municipal corporations.

The mayors asked for start up grants to new corporations and municipalities, increase of per capita grant and timely release of the assigned revenue for efficient developmental activity.

The chairman promised to make recommendations to government on concerned issues and requested mayors to send representations on administrative and financial devolutions. He said the Commission would include them in the report to be submitted the government.

Title: Coimbatore corporation steps up property tax collection, earns Rs 122 crore
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Representative image

COIMBATORE: As the financial year is coming to a close, city corporation officials are expediting property tax collection drive.

As on Monday, the corporation had collected Rs 122 crore as property tax, which is 62% of the total demand of Rs 197 crore. Last year, at the same time, the civic body had collected Rs 118 crore or 63% of the then the demand of Rs 187 crore.

Even though the corporation lags behind the collection drive by 1% compared to the previous year, the collected amount is much higher. Explaining that the number of assessments in the city increases with each passing day as the applications to levy property tax for new buildings is approved, a corporation official said that the demand for property tax would also increase along with the increase in assessments.

As on Monday, the city had 5.18 lakh assessments, including residential houses and commercial establishments.

The official said that the civic body had raised its property tax collection target from 95% to 97%, this year. “To achieve the target, we have set up special collection centres.”

As many as 29 collection centres are functioning across the city. They are open from 8am to 5pm from Monday to Saturday and even on Sundays from 8am to 2pm.

Until last year, the centres were functioning only from 9am to 2pm.

Meanwhile, the tax arrear demand is increasing every year. This year, the demand stands at Rs 32.58 crore, of which, the corporation has collected only Rs 8.26 crore, which is only 25% of the amount. “We have identified the top 100 defaulters in each zone and have issued notices to them,” the official added.

A couple of months ago, the state government had withheld its revised property tax in effect since April 2018 and had allowed property owners to pay the taxes at the pre-revision rates.

Title: 105-yr-old student cracks literacy exam
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Bhageerathiamma, who scored 74.5% marks, was honoured by Thrikkarauva grama panchayt president K Chandrasekhar... Read More

KOLLAM: A 105-year-old grandmother from Kerala, who appeared for the fourth standard equivalency examination, conducted by the state literacy mission last year, has come out with flying colours, making her one of the oldest students in the country to clear the papers. The result was announced by the literacy mission on Wednesday.

According to project co-coordinator Pradeep Kumar , Bhageerathiamma of Prakkulam in Kollam secured 74.5% marks in the exam .

The elderly woman, who studied till Class III at Prakkulam Govt LPS, had to give up her studies after her mother died and she had to take care of her siblings.

It was her friend Sarada teacher’s daughter and literacy mission master trainer S N Shirley and her husband and literacy mission’s key resource person K B Vasanthakumar who took the initiative to bring Bhageerathiamma, the mother of six and grandmother of 16, back to the world of letters. It took her more than one year to prepare for the exam. Due to her advanced age, she had difficulty in writing the exams and took three days to complete the 3 question papers on Environment, Mathematics and Malayalam, literacy mission sources said.

Despite her success in studies, the centenarian is unhappy that she has not yet been considered for old-age pension.

Thrikkarauva grama panchayt president K Chandrasekhara Pillai draped a ‘ponnada’ on Bhageerathi amma to honour her on her success. Panchayat secretary Sunil kumar, literacy mission master trainer S N Shirley, members Nandini and Sudhamani visited Bhageerathi amma’s daughter Thankamani’s house to honour the centenarian.

Title: Farmers in Sivaganga use fans for threshing paddy, incur extra cost
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

A farmer in Devakottai using electric fans to thresh paddy.

MADURAI: Paddy farmers in Sivaganga complained that despite them reaping a good harvest this year, they are forced to spend extra as they have to use high power electric fans due to lack of high velocity winds needed for threshing the crop.

“Our lands have been barren for the last few years, as most of them are rain-fed, but this year we had a good cultivation yet we are struggling to get a profit,” said P Ashokumar of Kesani village near Kappalur in Devakottai taluk. He said that many of the farmers had managed to get a good yield, but because of the delay in procurement of the crop, the paddy was being attacked by a bacterial infection, which resulted in them developing black ball like spots. Fans are rented for Rs 500 per day, when the ordinary rent for the same is only Rs 200. A labourer has to thresh the paddy by standing in front of the fan and about a tonne of paddy can be threshed in a day from 8 am to 5 pm.

Title: Tamil Nadu government schools lack office assistants, night watchmen
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Representative image

COIMBATORE: The state government should recruit office assistants (OAs) and night watchmen for government high and higher secondary schools , representatives of the School Education Department Administrative Workers Association said.

The representatives said that in some schools, as there are no OAs, teachers or clerks ring the school bell. “Chores such as collecting documents and communications from the district education offices are also now being done by teachers and clerks. These are jobs meant for office assistants,” said M Arunkumar, district president of the association. “The vacancies have not been filled in any of the high and higher secondary schools in the state. As many as 150 schools in the district don’t have OAs.”

Only half of the schools in the district have night watchmen, Arunkumar said. “This has created a sense of apprehension among HMs as there are possibilities of anti-social elements entering campuses at night. Night watchmen must be recruited soon,” he said. “Or, the state should allow government schools to hire them.”

Members of the association had put forth the demands to the Coimbatore chief education officer recently.

Title: Third solar plant soon to be commissioned at Ukkadam
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Representative image

COIMBATORE: The city corporation is getting ready to commission its third solar plant at Ukkadam.

The 3.6MW plant is the largest the corporation has installed so far. It is being installed on the 15 acres of land adjacent to the sewage treatment plant (STP) at Ukkadam. The Rs 17 crore facility has 1,286 solar panels, each with a capacity of 320W.

Corporation commissioner J Sravan Kumar said that even though the deadline to complete the installation work is in June, work is almost complete. “The plant will start functioning within a month or two,” he said.

The civic body already runs two solar plants each with a capacity of 1MW at Ukkadam and Kavundampalayam, constructed at a cost of Rs 5.5 crore each. “It has been a year since the first solar power plant at Ukkadam started generating power. It generates 15 lakh units every month and is saving the corporation a huge sum, which otherwise would have gone towards paying electricity bill for operating the water pumping station at Velliangadu,” the commissioner said.

Pointing out the difference in power tariff based on consumption level, Kumar said that the move to use the power generated by the plant to offset the electricity bills of pumping station has benefited the corporation as the station has high-tension (HT) supply. “We hope to make the return of investment (RoI) in less than four years.”

The corporation has made use of the places once used as dump yards for setting up the plants. The plant at Kavundampalayam became operational less than a month ago.

The corporation had recently received an award from the ministry of housing and urban affairs for conserving the urban environment by installing solar power plants.

Title: Counselling for PG teacher candidates
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Representative image

COIMBATORE: The counselling to post postgraduate (PG) teacher candidates, who have been selected to fill vacant posts in government schools in the state through the teacher recruitment board exam, would be held at the chief educational office at Town Hall on February 9 and 10.

While candidates for the PG teacher posts of Tamil, English, Commerce, Economics, History, Geography, Political Science, Home Science and Physical Education have been called for counselling on Sunday (February 9), those for Maths, Physics, Botany, Zoology and Biochemistry have been called on Monday (February 10). The counselling would be held online though educational management information system from 10am.

Title: No need for MSP letter to Centre: T
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Hyderabad: The state government on Wednesday said there was no need to send a proposal to the Centre on increasing MSP for turmeric. It rejected Union commerce minister Piyush Goyal’s advice on Tuesday that state government should send a letter recommending MSP for turmeric.

Addressing a press conference housing and R&B minister Vemula Prashanth Reddy said the state assembly had passed a resolution and there was no need to send a letter now. TNN

Title: Telangana worried about Rs 894 crore finance commission grant
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Representative image

HYDERABAD: As if the worries over diminishing central share of funds to Telangana are not enough, the state is now worried about the Rs 894-crore grant, which is supposed to come from the15th Finance Commission.

Of the huge grant recommended to Karnataka, Mizoram and Telangana by the commission, the state was to receive Rs 723 crore as its share. Similarly, the commission had recommended Rs 7,000 crore towards nutrition grant for all the states and Telangana’s share is around Rs 171 crore.

However, during Budget presentation, Union finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman presented a report which said that the Centre had asked finance commission to review recommendation of special grant to states, including Telangana. Highly-placed sources said government was evaluating cut in funds. The state budget, would reflect reduction in central allocation, sources said.

Title: Two killed in Ujjain road accident
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Representative image

INDORE: Two persons were killed and a 10-year-old boy was injured when a motorcycle they were riding on, was hit by a speeding truck at Bherugarh Square in Ujjain on Wednesday.

The truck driver could not control the vehicle and dragged victims for several meters before crashing into shops and overturning, Bherugarh police station ASI Guljar Singh Verma said.

The accident took place in the morning when Mohd Shafi, his mother-in-law Saeda Bi and son Ayub were on way to Agar Naka. Saeda Bi was planning to catch a bus to Mahidpur.

The truck hit the two-wheeler head-on and then crashed into pushcarts and shops on the roadside. People pulled out victims from the crashed vehicle and rushed them to a hospital.

Shafi and Saeda Bi were declared brought dead. Ayub was being treated at Madhav Nagar hospital and was reported critical.

The truck driver fled the spot soon after the accident, but the cleaner sustained injuries and was taken to district hospital. Police have seized the truck and were investigating the matter.

Title: NBW issued against DSP
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Mohali: The police have issued a non-bailable arrest warrant against DSP Atul Soni in the firing case.

Phase VIII police station house officer Shivdeep Singh Brar said, “We procured the arrest warrant of Soni on Tuesday. The non-bailable warrant is issued till March 30.” Mohali SP (investigation) Harmandeep Singh Hans said “We have even pasted a notice outside Soni’s house in Mohali and sent one to her wife on social media, asking them to join the investigation. Raids are being conducted at his possible hideouts.”

DSP Soni was suspended on Tuesday. He was booked on January 19 for allegedly shooting at his wife at their house after an altercation.

Mohali SSP Kuldeep Singh Chahal said, “We are going as per the process and an arrest warrant has been issued.”

A Mohali district court on January 21 had rejected his anticipatory bail on January 23. On January 24, the accused moved the Punjab and Haryana high court, which had stayed his arrest till January 31, when it dismissed his plea.

The incident had taken place in the early hours of January 19, when the DSP and his wife got into a spat at a club in Sector 26. Sunita Soni had then gone to her Mohali house along with her kids. The DSP followed her home and had allegedly shot at her but she escaped after her son pushed her aside. A case was then registered against the DSP at the Phase VIII police station. However, a day later, Sunita Soni claimed that she had sent an affidavit to the police mentioning that no such incident had not taken place.

Title: Manoj Tiwari promises pucca houses to all
Content:
This story is from February 5, 2020

DIFFERENT STROKES: Delhi BJP chief Manoj Tiwari joined a group of children at a jhuggi in Delhi Cantonment for... Read More

NEW DELHI: Delhi BJP chief Manoj Tiwari was in for a surprise on Wednesday when he saw that not more than 300 people had gathered to attend the rally scheduled in Delhi Cantonment .

He, however, promised to shift them all to pucca houses in two years if his party was voted to office.

Addressing the gathering there, Tiwari claimed that his party would solve all the problems faced by the local residents.

“BJP, in the past five years, made sure that the garbage was cleaned up regularly in the area. Our workers also ensured availability of mobile toilets for the convenience of everyone,” he said.

“Delhi chief minister says that every place in the city has electricity and water supply. Someone should just go and tell him that some places are still devoid of these two basic necessities,” he added.

Tiwari then spoke about “Jahan jhuggi, wahin makaan” scheme, promising all the slum dwellers pucca houses close to their shanties.

“All your worries will end if all of you have a two-room flat with access to electricity, gas connection and water at all times. Won’t these things make all of you happy? AAP government was elected from here last time but the face of this place has not changed a bit,” he claimed.

“This is Army land. We will give you the houses but that will happen in the next two years. Please do not expect us to deliver on this promise immediately after being elected,” he added.

He concluded the speech by singing his song, ‘Rinkiya ke papa’ and immediately went on to play cricket with the kids there. Seeing the bad state of the willow the kids were playing with, he asked his team to gift two bats to the children there.

Title: Builder gets Rs 60L extortion call
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Panchkula: A real estate developer has alleged he received an extortion call of Rs 60 lakh when he was in Mohali on Tuesday evening, prompting the police to register a case.

Dev Dutt Verma, a resident of Tower 2-A, Suncity Society, Sector 20, said he was going back home after finishing work at his construction site in Phase II, Mohali. When he reached Phase VII, Mohali, he said he received a WhatsApp call at 1.07pm, from an unknown mobile number ‘90795-50026’. “The caller took my name and told me that he knows where I live, which car I drive and what is its registration. He told me to arrange Rs 60 lakh. He said he tell me where to come with the money. He warned me not to take the call lightly, or he will kidnap me from my home,” Verma alleged. The accused later sent voice messages to the victim on his WhatsApp. Verma immediately rushed to the Sector 20 police station and submitted a complaint.

Police registered a zero FIR under Section 384 (punishment for extortion) of the IPC at sent it to the Mohali police for further investigation. Zero FIR can be filed in any police station regardless of the place of incident or jurisdiction.

Recent CASES

January 17 | Gurdial Singh, a resident of Phase X, Mohali, had lodged a complaint alleging that he received an extortion call of Rs 5 lakh from an unknown person who threatened him and said he would kill his two sons. Later, four people were arrested in the case.

September 20, 2019 | The UT police booked an unknown person for trying to extort money from the owner of a night club and bar situated at Sector 26 by using the name of notorious gangster Lawrence Bishnoi. The accused made a call on WhatsApp.

April 18, 2018: A member of Lawrence Bishnoi gang, Nehra made WhatsApp call and sent voice messages to Ashwani Kumar, owner of medical store in Sector 11, and demanded Rs 1 crore

April 14, 2018: Gangster Dilpreet Singh Baba made extortion call of Rs 10 lakh to Punjabi singer Parmish Verma. He also shot at the singer when he did not receive the extortion money. Later, the accused was arrested

Title: Coronavirus outbreak: Chinese restaurants continue to do brisk business in Coimbatore
Content:
Representative image

COIMBATORE: Anything related to the word ‘China’ shouldn’t be immediately related to 2019-nCoV.Though neighbouring Kerala reported three confirmed cases of novel coronavirus , it has not deterred customers from devouring their favourite dishes from three oldest Chinese restaurants in the city.These restaurants started by Chinese families and other restaurants say they have not seen a fall or change in business since the outbreak of the new virus in Hubei province in mainland China.The Chinese restaurants are now run by the third generation of the families and they are not looked down on after the outbreak.Their non-vegetarian orders, including pork, too has not changed, they say.Regulars to these restaurants don’t find any reason to believe the messages doing rounds on WhatsApp and Facebook stating that the virus outbreak was due to Chinese eating too many animals and often raw.Micheal Paun, whose grandfather moved to Coimbatore from China at the age of 10 and started Peking restaurants in the city, said there has been no change in business due to the virus. “We have not seen any fall in business over the last three weeks,” Paun said. “In fact, not a single customer has even bothered to discuss about the virus or how we cook our meat,” he said. “Many of our customers come to us specially for pork. Sales of pork has not reduced,” he added.Other two popular Chinese restaurants, Kowloon and Ninhao, report the same status. “Nobody doubts the way we cook our meat or hygiene. They sometimes ask us the ingredients to understand a taste but not doubt our hygiene,” said a worker at Kowloon restaurant which is again started by a Chinese family. “Like most restaurants, we also have employees only from northeast India,” he said.Sharika of Ninhao said they do not even source ingredients from China and most of their customers know that. “I don’t think they even associate the virus to Chinese restaurants,” she said. Even top Chinese restaurants in star hotels like Red Pearl in the Taj, Chin in The Residency Towers and Ponzu in Le Meridien say business has not changed.

Title: TNSTC launches awareness vehicle for Palani pilgrims
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

A TNSTC vehicle carrying a message requesting vehicles to exercise caution as many pilgrims are walking to the... Read More

MADURAI: The Tamil Nadu State Transport Corporation (TNSTC) has launched a campaign in Dindigul district to create awareness among the lakhs of pilgrims who are walking to the Palani Dhandayudhapani temple for the Thaipoosam festival.

With just three days left for the culminating event, thousands of pilgrims walk along the Madurai - Bengaluru highway and also toward the temple, on the Battalagundu and Sempatti routes.

The Dindigul district administration has introduced many safety measures for these pilgrims including glowing wrist bands and battens, which are distributed by the police en route.

As most pilgrims walk dangerously through the middle of the road during the rush period, the TNSTC has introduced a traffic awareness vehicle service, on directions of the managing director of the Tamil Nadu State Transport Corporation (Madurai), M A Murugesan. The vehicle would be operated on the pilgrimage route 24 hours of the day, with public announcement systems informing the pilgrims of the safety measures.

People would be asked to walk on the pavements, take note of the vehicles coming in the opposite direction, take care in the curves, avoid walking with headphones, take care of elders, differently abled people, children and women.

Title: Kanyakumari MP seeks speaker’s help to repair damaged national highway
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Tired of making repeated representations to the highway authorities and district administration and staging demonstrations to mend the badly damaged Nagercoil to Thiruvananthapuram national highway (NH), Kanyakumari MP H Vasanthakumar has sought the help of Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla.

The MP raised the issue on Wednesday pertaining to stating that the highway was not repaired for two years, despite funds to the tune of Rs 49 crore sanctioned for that purpose. He accused the highways department officials of remaining mute spectators to repeated representations.

Vasanthakumar said the contractor neither got the job done nor responded positively whenever he approached him over the issue. Pressing on the urgency of the matter, he said that people of his constituency are calling him incapable of getting such a small task done.

So, he appealed to the Speaker to instruct the highways ministry to rectify the road.

Title: Goa: Crores in unpaid bills exposes government’s empty coffers
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Several bills pertain to the South Goa district hospital

PROVORIM: In the assembly, chief minister Pramod Sawant may insist that the state’s finances are intact, but the state’s unpaid bills tell a different story. Goa State Infrastructure Development Corporation, of which Sawant is chairman, owes Rs 91.7 crore to contractors for 177 contracts, data released by the state government shows.

The unpaid bills are for a variety of contracts, from construction to purchase of medical equipment.

GFP president Vijai Sardesai sought information on all outstanding payments to contractors in a legislative assembly question, based on which the data was provided.

Sardesai claimed that contractors' bills to the tune of Rs 767 crore were not paid, as the government lacked funds to clear the pending dues.

Several bills pertain to the South Goa district hospital, which remains incomplete till date.

Sawant also admitted in a written reply that aside from the state’s outstanding loans, government corporations and autonomous bodies such as GSIDC, Kadamba Transport Corporation, Goa Tourism Development Corporation, Imagine Panaji Smart City Development Ltd., Sewerage Corporation, Goa Waste Management Corporation, Sanjivani Sakhar Karkhana and Goa Industrial Development Corporation have loans amounting to Rs 359.6 crore as on March 31, 2019. In the current financial year, these agencies have borrowed an additional Rs 158.7 crore, Sawant informed the House.

The state government’s liabilities stand at Rs 20,411.6 crore and in 2019-20, Goa has borrowed Rs 2,081 crore out of the Rs 2,691 crore limit prescribed by the Union ministry of finance. Most of these funds, the government said, were spent on infrastructure projects in the state.

“The government has never defaulted in repayment of debt. The state is maintaining a Consolidated Sinking Fund and Guarantee Redemption Fund with the Reserve Bank of India as a buffer for repayment,” said Sawant.

Title: Central Vista: Veil of secrecy in DDA hearing on land use
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

NEW DELHI: A public hearing on the change of land use of seven plots in the capital’s Central Vista , which will pave the way for a new Parliament House and many government offices to come up, was held behind closed doors at Delhi Development Authority’s (DDA) headquarters at Vikas Sadan on Thursday. The media was not allowed to cover the proceedings and a few respondents said that they were also barred from recording the hearing process on their mobile phones.

In December, the authority had changed the land use of seven plots spread over 100 acres, including that of a 15-acre plot on Dalhousie Road near South Block where a new Prime Minister’s residence has been proposed under the Central Vista redevelopment project. The approved change of land use of these plots was put in the public domain for suggestions and objections for 30 days and a two-day public hearing started on Thursday where those who had sent their suggestions or objections were allowed to speak.

“The change of land use is a precursor to all the changes envisaged, yet people were given very short notice for the public hearing. Why is the housing and urban affairs ministry not putting out the details of their plan in the public domain?” asked Narayan Moorthy, an architect, who was one of the respondents.

Senior DDA officials, however, said that they have followed all the procedures laid for the change of land use. The media is not allowed at public hearings so that “there is no ruckus,” said an official. “A notice for hearing is given one or two days in advance as per procedure,” the official added.

“The hearing happens before a board of inquiry, which is free to give its recommendations. After this, the changes will be put before the authority in a meeting chaired by the lieutenant governor of Delhi. The final decision is then taken and sent to the Centre for notification,” said the official.

“If the Prime Minister residence comes here, the boat club will become a high-security zone, and people will not be able to visit the area,” said SL Ganapathi, a businessman and another respondent.

Amritha Ballal, an architect, asked why are the documents regarding the redevelopment project not in the public domain. “This is erasure of history that must be contested,” said Iram Sultan, an interior designer.

Meenakshi Nath, another respondent, claimed that some of the proposed buildings would have four-level basements, which will hamper recharging of groundwater and flow of water to Yamuna.

“Our role is limited as we are only responsible for changing the land use. We have taken care that the change will not lead to Delhi’s green area shrinking,” a DDA official said. “Also, the total load on Delhi will not increase as offices are not coming from outside,” he added.

Title: Pump testing lab to get a facelift
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Representative image

COIMBATORE: The oldest pump testing laboratory in the region, on the campus of the Branch MSME Development Institute at Ram Nagar here, is all set to get a makeover soon.

The ministry of MSME has sanctioned Rs 1.08 crore to renovate the laboratory infrastructure.

The facility was opened as an extension centre in 1959 along with an electric motor testing laboratory. In 1979, it was upgraded to a development institute, where pumps were tested. The lab is now accredited by the National Accreditation Board for Testing and Calibration Laboratories and recognised by the Bureau of Indian Standards (BIS).

The renovation work is in progress and Rs 2lakh for the initial work and Rs 85,000 for shifting cables was released, said branch head of the institute R Vijayakumar. “The work has been taken up by the central public works department (CPWD),” he said. The institute has two separate facilities one to test motors and another to test pumpsets, mainly agricultural pumpsets. “BIS collects random samples from manufacturers and give them to us for testing to find whether they comply with the norms and standards. We test them and provide the results to BIS,” Vijayakumar said.

The lab has a capacity to test up to 20HP pumps. It can test two samples per day.

Among others, the lab has equipment such as volumetric tank for tracking discharge, voltmeter and ammeter to test voltage and current the pumps work at and flowmeter. “We calibrate the equipment every year by taking them to the Fluid Control Research Institute at Kanjikode in Kerala . We have also submitted a proposal to modernise the labs,” the official said.

While the motor testing lab can test all kinds of motors, the pump testing lab can test agricultural pumps, submersible pumps and centrifugal pumps.

The city has another pump testing lab at the Scientific and Industrial Testing and Research Centre (SiTarc) at Avarampalayam .

Title: Driving licences to persons with disability doubled in 2019
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Panaji: The number of driving licences issued to persons with disabilities doubled in 2019 compared to the previous year. A total of 50 driving licences were issued to members of the community last year, unlike 2018, wherein only 25 were issued.

This was revealed during the LAQs at the ongoing assembly session tabled by Curtorim MLA Aleixo Lourenco.

Figures also revealed, that of the 50 licences issued in 2019, three were issued to persons with hearing impairment. The same number of licenced (3) were issued to persons with hearing impairment in 2018, as opposed to 2017, when only one person was issued a driving licence.

The licensing authorities had received more applications from the community; however, 16 licences were rejected last year. Of these, 13 licences rejected were to persons with hearing impairment,data revealed.“Rejection of applications for driving licence is exclusively based on the recommendation of the medical board that the person with disability is found unfit to safely drive a motor vehicle,” transport minister Mauvin Godinho stated in his reply.

While the new Motor Vehicle (Amendment) Bill, 2019, which was passed by the Lok Sabha last year, is yet to be implemented in Goa, the amended rules further enable persons with disabilities to acquire a driver’s licence, in a move towards inclusion.

The rules enable the conversion of a motor vehicle into an adapted vehicle to be used by persons with disabilities, provided the modified vehicle meets safety and emission requirements.

Title: Three Kerala priests stripped of duties over allegations of sexual abuse
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Among the three, one of the priests is also facing a police probe as a woman who was allegedly abused by the p... Read More

KOTTAYAM: Three priests of Malankara Orthodox Syrian Church were banned from the parish ministry following allegations of sexual abuse of women.

According to a senior clergy of the church, Fr Varghese Markose of Kooroppada , Fr Varghese M Varghese of Meenadom and Rony Varghese of Pakkil have been temporarily stripped of their vicar post. Though they won’t be excommunicated at the moment, the church has begun a detailed probe on the complaints. The church is expected to come out with an official press release soon. All the priests who were removed from the posts of vicar belong to Kottayam diocese of the orthodox church. They have been banned from the parish ministry by Synod secretary of the church metropolitan Yuhanon Mar Dioscoros.

Among the three, one of the priests is also facing a police probe as a woman who was allegedly abused by the priest had committed suicide. The woman’s husband had filed a police complaint after her death. Fr Rony Varghese too had faced disciplinary action from the church earlier following complaints including immoral conduct. The church is expected to take further action against the priests following a detailed report from an inquiry commission.

Title: TN: 17 years on, two IPS officers get clean chit
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Representative image

CHENNAI: Two criminal appeals filed by two IPS officers and pending in the Madras high court for 17 years, were finally disposed of on Wednesday, when the court trashed a sessions court order convicting the officers under the Prevention of Corruption Act.

Justice M Dhandapani, acquitting E Hariharane (since deceased) and G Veeraraghavan, who had both served as directors-general of police, fire services department, between May 1989 and July 1992, said: “The trial court totally got carried away by the figures portrayed than by the materials, in black and white, available before it to come to a reasonable and justifiable conclusion. Therefore, left with no alternative, this court is inclined to set aside the conviction and sentence recorded by the trial court as being devoid of any merit.”

The prosecution had alleged that the two officers had incurred a pecuniary loss of Rs 1.77 crore and Rs 31.56 lakh to the exchequer in the purchase of pumps, construction of emergency rescue tender and purchase of high capacity portable pumps. It said the officers floated and finalised tenders and awarded the contract in breach of not only the tender conditions, but also giving a go-by to specifications, thereby facilitating pecuniary advantage to the supplier. It said the conspiracy was hatched by the officers between May 1989 and July 1992.

Title: TRS slams BJP for turmeric board
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Representative image

HYDERABAD: A day after the Centre made it clear that Nizamabad would get a regional centre of Spices Board, TRS charged BJP and Nizamabad MP Dharmapuri Arvind with making false promises to people of the constituency.

Armoor MLA and chairman of the public undertakings committee of the assembly A Jeevan Reddy alleged that Arvind had promised to get a turmeric board for Nizamabad within five days after he won as MP in 2019. Jeevan added regional centres of Spices Board were already functioning in Warangal and Guntur and had not served any purpose to farmers. “It looks like farmers asked for biryani and Centre served them stale food,” he said. Jeevan said the demand for turmeric board in Nizamabad was pending since 1986.

Title: Railway Pink Book disappoints commuters in Marathwada
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Provision of Rs 100 crore for installing the Traffic Collision Avoidance System (TCAS) between Manmad-Nanded-S... Read More

AURANGABAD: The much-awaited railway Pink Book that came out on Wednesday — four days after the Union Budget — has generated angry reactions from the passenger community in Marathwada as the region has once again been ignored.

Even if the South Central Railway (SCR) has been sanctioned Rs 6,846 crore towards infrastructure development for the year 2020-21, Aurangabad and Marathwada as a whole have nothing much to cheer owing to meagre budgetary allocations.

Barring Rs 75 crore allocation for Mudkhed-Parbhani doubling project along with Rs 50 crore and Rs 20 crore for electrification of Manmad-Mudkhed-Dhone and Pipalkutti-Mudhked sections and Parbhani-Parli Vaijnath section respectively, the budget has no major announcements for Marathwada.

Provision of Rs 100 crore for installing the Traffic Collision Avoidance System (TCAS) between Manmad-Nanded-Secunderabad-Dhone-Guntakal and Bidar-Parli-Parbhani sections is among the very few bright spots for the region.

Railway activist Raj Somani said the railway Pink Book — containing all the details about the infrastructure works, demands for grants and comprehensive details of budgetary allocations for carrying out various works in Railways — has disappointed the passenger community in Marathwada.

“After sustained follow up with railway authorities for pursuing different connectivity and infrastructural demands, we had hopes for some major announcements. However, the policy makers have once again neglected Marathwada,” he said.

Another railway activist said they were hopeful of receiving budgetary provision for laying down the new line from Rotegaon to Kopargaon, and construction of pit-line in Aurangabad.

“A new rail line on the 22-kilometer route between Rotegaon and Kopargaon has been one of the most sought after new routes in the region for the past few years. The route had received official sanction in 2017-18, but no work has taken place due to lack of money. The route will curtail travel time to Shirdi via Aurangabad considerably and ease traffic on busy Manmad junction,” veteran railway activist Omprakash Varma said.

While former SCR divisional railway manager (Nanded division) A K Sinha had formally announced in March 2017 that the pit-line would be set up at Chikalthana, nothing has been done towards it yet.

The rail budget has allocated Rs 11 crore for development of Tiruchanur railway station in Andhra Pradesh, but there is no mention of financial boost to development of Aurangabad railway station.

When contacted, a senior SCR official said some of the key pending demands of Marathwada would be fulfilled soon. “There is no question of giving preferential treatment to any region. Our zone comprises six divisions and we are committed to serve each zone in an effective manner. The zone as a whole has some demands in the pipeline and the same would be addressed soon,” he said

Title: Rajasthan: Buy a bike, get helmet free from April 1
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Photo for representative purpose only

JAIPUR: In a move to promote road safety especially of two-wheeler riders, the state government on Wednesday declared to distribute free helmet with the purchase of two-wheelers from April 1.

These helmets would be distributed on every purchase of scooters and motorbikes by the dealers across the state. The announcement came while the state government is on the verge of implementing the Amended Motor Vehicles Act, 2019 in the state with increased penalties.

State transport minister, Pratap Singh Khachariyawas held a meeting with the automobile dealers along with the officials of his department.

“Any person buying a new motorcycle, scooter or any other two-wheeler in Rajasthan would be provided ISI-marked helmet free by the dealers of motorbike and scooter. We had a meeting in this regard in which all the dealers have given their consent to it,” Khachariyawas said while talking to TOI.

Khachariyawas added that this has been made mandatory for the dealers of two-wheelers.

“The number of persons getting killed while driving two-wheelers without helmet is very high and is a big matter of concern for the government. We are aiming at reducing these accidents and this will also help us to ensure 100 per cent compliance of wearing helmets by two-wheeler riders across the state,” he added.

All representatives of automobile dealer companies were present in the meeting chaired by the minister and officials including transport commissioner Rajesh Yadav and others at Transport Bhawan.

Title: National Deworming Day on February 10
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

MANGALURU: The department of health and family welfare , Dakshina Kannada, is gearing up for the second phase of National Deworming Day that will be observed across India on Monday.

Children in the age group of 1 to 19 will be administered Albendazole as part of the nationwide campaign. While children in the age-group of 1-2 will be given half of the 400mg Albendazole tablet, those in the age-group of 2-19 will be given a full tablet.

Ramakrishna Rao, district health and family welfare officer, told reporters that the campaign into its sixth year, strives to address health issues such as malnutrition that worm infestation causes in children, who generally are vulnerable to it. Malnutrition results in stunted growth and has long-term effects on the growth and development of any child, he said, adding administering the tablet on a campaign mode will address this basic health issue.

All stakeholders including anganwadi and school teachers, ASHA workers and department staff have been trained to successfully carry out the campaign, he said. “Apprehensions of parents in the campaign having possible side-effects on health of their children is misplaced and the tablet is absolutely safe,” he said, adding even if the tablet is administered for the second time in close proximity, there will be no health implications for the children.

Dr Rajesh B V, reproductive and child health officer, said the district had received around 6 lakh Albendazole tablets for distribution among 5,29,160 beneficiaries in the above target age group. “We have distributed the tablets to schools and colleges, and teachers there, with help from department staff, will administer it,” said Dr Rajesh. Teams have been set up at taluk levels to address any unforeseen yet unlikely complications as part of the drive, he said.

The district health authorities have sought information from their counterparts in neighbouring Kasaragod about the people who were in contact with the people that tested positive for coronavirus, he said. There are no health issues with students from Kasaragod coming to Dakshina Kannada for education or other purposes, as the coronavirus-affected patients there have been kept in quarantine and are being treated there, said Dr Ramakrishna Rao.

Title: Tamil Nadu police department to crack the whip on hoax call makers
Content:
This story is from February 6, 2020

Representative image

MADURAI: Taking a serious view on those who make hoax bomb threat phone calls to police units and sending threatening letters, the Tamil Nadu police department has decided to crack the whip against the trouble mongers. Often, trouble mongers go unpunished as police take a lenient view on them considering their positions. Most of the trouble mongers make such calls when they are stressed out, under influence of alcohol or just for fun. In some incidents, even school children make such calls to get a holiday from school, fearing examinations.

Police sources said that on an average two to four such hoax calls/letters are received in a year by the Madurai city police alone. Every time such hoax calls land in the police control room or 108 call centre, the police unit concerned comes to its toes in search of bombs. Police never take such incidents lightly and comb the entire premises to which the threat was received with utmost care

In a communication from the superintendent’s office of Q branch CID, Chennai dated February 4, sent to all police commissioners, superintendents of police and deputy commissioners they have been asked to prepare and send data on such incidents in the past. Details such as number of calls/letters, action taken against them, details of the trouble mongers with address, gist of the case and copy of audio/letter have been sought. The data for the past 20 years, till January 31 has been asked to be sent before the end of February.

“It is to inform that in the recent past the number of letters and hoax calls increased manifold. Every time a hoax calls is made the police officers are ill-equipped in conducting inquiry due to lack of information available on the past incidents. In order to ensure that swift and prompt investigation, it is necessary to maintain data of past incidents and trouble mongers” the letter read. A police officer from Madurai said that this is the first time such data is being collected and it is an indication of series of action awaiting trouble mongers. In some incidents, the trouble mongers have not been traced, whereas in many incidents they have been left off with severe warnings.
